translated: Therefore, all of this is the conceit of the mind that is born from the bad views that have been cultivated for many eons. This is the point that is being made clear.

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is how it is expressed.

original: snang ba 'grib pas mi gsal ba dang mtshan mo sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa yod par 'gyur ba na de'i gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin rdzas dmigs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: snang ba 'grib pas mi gsal ba dang mtshan mo sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa yod par 'gyur ba na de'i gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin rdzas dmigs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the object of apprehension of the eye consciousness is a substance because blue and so on that exist as the substantial cause of the visual form that is perceived when light is present are not perceived when light is diminished and is unclear or at night,

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be addressed.

original: de la ci 'dra ba zhig gis rdzas dmigs pa yin no zhe na /üîΩsnang ba nyid de snang ba mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci 'dra ba zhig gis rdzas dmigs pa yin no zhe na / snang ba nyid de snang ba mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: What kind of light is the object of apprehension of a substance?

original: snang ba 'grib cing mi gsal ba'i tshe sngo skya'i gzugs de nye bar len pa'i gzugs kyang dmigs so //
analyzed: snang ba 'grib cing mi gsal ba'i tshe sngo skya'i gzugs de nye bar len pa'i gzugs kyang dmigs so //
translated: If you say that light itself is the object of apprehension of a substance, then when light is diminished and is unclear, the blue-gray form that is the substantial cause of the visual form that is perceived when light is present is not perceived.

original: gzugs de de'i ngo bo ma yin na de ma thag tu bshad pa'i phyogs nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs de de'i ngo bo ma yin na de ma thag tu bshad pa'i phyogs nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that form is not its nature, then the position just explained is undermined.

original: de dang nye ba'i logs na yod pa'i de ltar dmigs pa med cing gzhan gyi rnam pa'i blos kyang dngos po de rtogs pa ma yin te /üîΩgang yang rung ba'i rnam par @79a * //
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i logs na yod pa'i de ltar dmigs pa med cing gzhan gyi rnam pa'i blos kyang dngos po de rtogs pa ma yin te /üîΩgang yang rung ba'i rnam par @79a * //
translated: The form that is perceived when light is present is not perceived in the form that is present in the place adjacent to it, and the thing is not cognized by a mind that has the aspect of something else.

original: shes pa dngos po thams cad gcod pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dngos po thams cad gcod pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that consciousness would be able to apprehend all things.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore this is a mistaken consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa ni sa bon gyi rgyun babs pa 'am rgyu med pa'i dus su yul med pa nyid du da ltar snang bar 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni sa bon gyi rgyun babs pa 'am rgyu med pa'i dus su yul med pa nyid du da ltar snang bar 'grub ste /
translated: Mistaken consciousnesses are established as appearing to be without external objects either when the continuum of seeds has not yet arisen or when there is no cause,

original: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa bzhin du nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa bzhin du nye bar skye'o //
translated: just as the consciousness of a double moon arises.

original: gang gi phyir yul med du zin kyang so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus su 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul med du zin kyang so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus su 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though there is no external object, it arises in a specific place and time

original: rang gi nye bar len pa'i bag chags sad par byed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi bdag po'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa'i bag chags sad par byed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi bdag po'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it awakens the latent potentialities that are its own and because it depends on an external dominant condition.

original: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang don la ma bslus te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang don la ma bslus te /
translated: Even though it is mistaken, like the consciousness of a double moon, it is not mistaken with regard to its object,

original: khyad par can gyi bdag po'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bdag po'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the special dominant condition exists.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu bzhin du don la mi slu ba nyid ni yul med pa mi rigs pa nyid ni yin na rjes su dpag pa'i ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu bzhin du don la mi slu ba nyid ni yul med pa mi rigs pa nyid ni yin na rjes su dpag pa'i ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not tenable that the object does not exist, because inference is not indefinite.

original: nor bu 'khrul pa de nyid ni rdzas la da ltar 'dzin pa de'i yul med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nor bu 'khrul pa de nyid ni rdzas la da ltar 'dzin pa de'i yul med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the jewel‚Äôs error is that it apprehends the present substance, then its object would not be nonexistent.

original: 'o na de'i rdzas de dang de'i ngo bo ma yin pa gzhan gyi rnam pa rjes su 'brangs pa'i shes pa bzhin yongs su gcod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'o na de'i rdzas de dang de'i ngo bo ma yin pa gzhan gyi rnam pa rjes su 'brangs pa'i shes pa bzhin yongs su gcod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But we have already explained that the substance of that jewel is not that entity, but is the form of another object that is being reflected.

original: de ltar na yang yul dang bcas la ltos pa yang yul dang bcas pa yod par 'gyur ba nyid ni 'di ltar autpala la sogs pa de ltar snang ngo zhes kho bos kyang brjod par nus te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang yul dang bcas la ltos pa yang yul dang bcas pa yod par 'gyur ba nyid ni 'di ltar autpala la sogs pa de ltar snang ngo zhes kho bos kyang brjod par nus te /
translated: Even so, we can say that the object that is the basis of the appearance of a reflection exists, just as we can say that the object that is the basis of the appearance of a lotus exists.

original: 'khrul pa de the tshom gyi rgyu rnams med du zin kyang snang ba'i gnas skabs su rung ba'i yul na gnas pa dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i gnas skabs su de'i rdzas kyi bdag gzugs snang ba las tha dad pa ni mi dmigs la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de the tshom gyi rgyu rnams med du zin kyang snang ba'i gnas skabs su rung ba'i yul na gnas pa dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i gnas skabs su de'i rdzas kyi bdag gzugs snang ba las tha dad pa ni mi dmigs la /
translated: Even though the causes of doubt are absent, when the object is present, the substance of the self is not observed to be different from the appearance of form.üîΩAnd when the object is distant, the substance of the self is not observed to be different from the appearance of form.

original: skrag pa 'khrul ba'i the tshom gyi rgyu mtshan mun pas chod pa'i gnas skabs dang yul ring ba'i gnas skabs na sgrib pa dang bcas pa la yang de bzhin gyi rnam pa las tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba smos pa la su zhig gisüîΩbrjod par nus /
analyzed: skrag pa 'khrul ba'i the tshom gyi rgyu mtshan mun pas chod pa'i gnas skabs dang yul ring ba'i gnas skabs na sgrib pa dang bcas pa la yang de bzhin gyi rnam pa las tha dad par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba smos pa la su zhig gis brjod par nus /
translated: Who could say that the appearance of the self is different from the appearance of form?

original: lcags kyi khrab kyi nang gi skyes bu'i shes pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: lcags kyi khrab kyi nang gi skyes bu'i shes pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of a person inside iron armor is not direct perception.

original: 'on kyang rtags can yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtags can yin no //
translated: However, it is inferential.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i lus kyi cha shas la brten pa'i stobs las byung ba'i khyad par gyi dbyibs su rnam par gnas pa khrab can @79b mthong ba las 'bras bu'i rtags kyi shes pa 'brel pa dran pa ltos nas rgyur gyur pa'i rnam pa de lta bu yinüîΩno zhe na /üîΩde ma thag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa bsgrub pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa dang bcas par rtogs pa gang yin zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i lus kyi cha shas la brten pa'i stobs las byung ba'i khyad par gyi dbyibs su rnam par gnas pa khrab can @79b mthong ba las 'bras bu'i rtags kyi shes pa 'brel pa dran pa ltos nas rgyur gyur pa'i rnam pa de lta bu yin no zhe na / de ma thag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa bsgrub pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa dang bcas par rtogs pa gang yin zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i khrab can gyi dbyibs las skyes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rgyur 'gyur gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i khrab can gyi dbyibs las skyes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rgyur 'gyur gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas las ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.üîΩThe cognition of the effect, the sign, is dependent on the recollection of the relation, and the form of the cause is of that kind.

original: de la ma grub pas ma grub pa'i rnam pa gnyis las khas blangs par mi rigs kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur grub pa de dag nyid las de bzhin du dbyibs nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: de la ma grub pas ma grub pa'i rnam pa gnyis las khas blangs par mi rigs kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur grub pa de dag nyid las de bzhin du dbyibs nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro
translated: Since that is not established, it is not reasonable to assert that shape is not established in the two ways, because form and so on are established as cause and effect of direct perception and nonobservation, and shape is present in them in the same way.

original: // snam bu yang le brtan dang btsod ka la sogs par bsgyur bas don gzhan nyid de las de bzhin du skye bar mthong gi sna tshogs pa'i rdzas dag dang 'dres pa'i dbyer med pa las de bzhin du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: // snam bu yang le brtan dang btsod ka la sogs par bsgyur bas don gzhan nyid de las de bzhin du skye bar mthong gi sna tshogs pa'i rdzas dag dang 'dres pa'i dbyer med pa las de bzhin du mi dmigs so //
translated: Also, a cloth is seen to arise from threads that are different from it, since it is transformed into white, red, and so on, but it is not observed to arise from a mixture of various substances that are not different from it.

original: de'i rdzas rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu rgyun chad na de ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rdzas rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu rgyun chad na de ldog pa yin te /
translated: When the continuum of the cause of the endurance of its substance is severed, it ceases.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos nas chu dang med la sogs pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos nas chu dang med la sogs pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In dependence on the appropriated cause, water and milk and so on arise as something else.

original: 'dis ni lcags gong dang mi dag de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa'i shes pas mthong zhes bya ba de yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lcags gong dang mi dag de'i ngo bor 'dzin pa'i shes pas mthong zhes bya ba de yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the statement ‚ÄúIron and humans are seen by the consciousness apprehending them as having that nature.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rdzas de mngon sum gyis ma grub par bshad nas ba lang dang rta dang / ma he dang phag dang phye ma leb la yid gnyis 'byung ba'i rten gzugs las tha dad par brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas de mngon sum gyis ma grub par bshad nas ba lang dang rta dang / ma he dang phag dang phye ma leb la yid gnyis 'byung ba'i rten gzugs las tha dad par brjod do //
translated: Thus, having explained that the substance is not established by direct perception, it is said to be different from the form that is the basis for the doubt that arises in regard to an ox, a horse, a buffalo, a pig, and a butterfly.

original: dbang po nyid du gyur pas gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa phyi rol du dbang pos mi gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po nyid du gyur pas gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa phyi rol du dbang pos mi gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it becomes a sense faculty, it does not cut off external objects such as form, etc.,

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang bsal bar bya'o //
translated: like pleasure, etc. That also should be refuted.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang snang ba las tha dad pa ma dmigs pa de dang de ni tha dad par khas blang bar mi bya 'am med pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang snang ba las tha dad pa ma dmigs pa de dang de ni tha dad par khas blang bar mi bya 'am med pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not observed to be different from what appears is not to be accepted as different from it, or it is to be accepted as nonexistent.

original: dper na mi'i mgo'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi'i mgo'i rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a human.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang tha dad pa'i spyi'i dang bye brag dang ldan pa rnal ma dbye ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang tha dad pa'i spyi'i dang bye brag dang ldan pa rnal ma dbye ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-observation of a pervader is as follows: ‚ÄúThe blue, etc., do not have a real universal and particular that are different from them, because of the non-observation of a difference and non-difference, etc.‚Äù

original: ma grub pa ni ma yin te /üîΩsnang ba nyid du rang @80a * //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ma yin te / snang ba nyid du rang @80a * //
translated: It is not unestablished,

original: nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you yourself accept that it appears.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnam pa lnga las tha dad pa'i rdzas khas len pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid du khas blangs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs spangs pa'i phyir sgra dang dri dang ro bzhin duüîΩmig gi shes pas nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnam pa lnga las tha dad pa'i rdzas khas len pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid du khas blangs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs spangs pa'i phyir sgra dang dri dang ro bzhin du mig gi shes pas nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the acceptance of a substance that is different from the five kinds of objects such as form, etc., is the acceptance of its being an object of perception, but it is not ascertained by visual consciousness, because it is excluded from the form of color such as blue, etc., like sound, smell, and taste.

original: reg bya la brten pa'i shes pa nyid kyi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya la brten pa'i shes pa nyid kyi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained by the consciousness that is based on the tangible,üîΩbecause it is not ascertained by the consciousness that is based on the tangible.

original: snang ba nyid du khas blangs pa nyid rtsub mo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba nyid du khas blangs pa nyid rtsub mo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The reason that the appearance of blue, etc., is not a different substantial entity from consciousness is because it is accepted as an appearance, and because it is devoid of the nature of roughness, etc., like sound, etc.

original: kha dog sngon po'i gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa so sor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //üîΩspyi la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gnyis kyi gtan tshigs la ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po'i gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa so sor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o // spyi la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gnyis kyi gtan tshigs la ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The valid cognition that contradicts the consequence that the appearance of blue, etc., would be different from the form of blue, etc., is as follows.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not uncertain regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not unestablished regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.

original: de dag med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad bsdus nas khyab pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no //üîΩyang na gal te mig dang reg bya'i shes pa dag gis tha mi dad pa'i rdzas nyid yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro // thams cad bsdus nas khyab pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no // yang na gal te mig dang reg bya'i shes pa dag gis tha mi dad pa'i rdzas nyid yul ma yin te /
translated: The reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not unestablished regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.

original: tha dad pa'i rnal ma'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra dang dri'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnal ma'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra dang dri'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the two kinds of valid cognition is because it has already been established that they are the objects of conventional cognition.üîΩThe reason that the universal, etc., are not contradictory regarding the

original: de bzhin du rdzas kyang dbang po gnyis kyi gzung bya yin pas zhes bya ba des bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas kyang dbang po gnyis kyi gzung bya yin pas zhes bya ba des bsal ba yin no //
translated: So too, the substance is the object of the two sense organs.

original: yul gcig pa nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
translated: The argument that the consequence is the nonexistence of a single object is invalidated by the evidence of direct perception.

original: snang ba'i pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is said that the two are perceived as different.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin te /
translated: The reason is not established.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i kha dog gi so sor snang ba nyid dang reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rtsub mo la sogs pa so sor snang ba nyid kyi rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i kha dog gi so sor snang ba nyid dang reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rtsub mo la sogs pa so sor snang ba nyid kyi rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the individual appearance of color to the visual consciousness and the individual appearance of roughness, etc., to the tactile consciousness are established by direct perception that is self-cognizant.

original: de lta na gal te rtsub mo la sogs pa la brten par brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na gal te rtsub mo la sogs pa la brten par brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that the reason is that they are based on roughness, etc., then it is merely the establishment of what is already established.

original: 'on te nying po la sogs pa'i rdzas yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te nying po la sogs pa'i rdzas yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the reason is that they are the substance of the core, etc., then the reason is not established.

original: gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba'i ring po dang thung du dang lham pa dang zlum po dag yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba'i ring po dang thung du dang lham pa dang zlum po dag yin no //
translated: Because long, short, square, round, etc. are seen by the eye.

original: zhes lus kyi shes pas kyang ma mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes lus kyi shes pas kyang ma mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But the body sense faculty does not see them.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa shes pa ni lus kyi dbang po las shes pa @80b ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa shes pa ni lus kyi dbang po las shes pa @80b ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of long, etc. is not knowledge from the body sense faculty,

original: de ltar rtogs pa yin na kha dog kyang de la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa yin na kha dog kyang de la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that were so, color would also appear to it.

original: reg bya la brten pa'i shes pa nyid la kha dog snang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya la brten pa'i shes pa nyid la kha dog snang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that color should appear to the knowledge that is based on tactility.

original: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of visual consciousness.

original: rtsub mo la sogs pa nyid la snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yin ni dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rtsub mo la sogs pa nyid la snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i yin ni dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thought that is the memory of the knowledge of color and tactility is the knowledge of long, etc.

original: de skad du mig dang lus dag ji ltar rang gi yul tha dad pa la dmigs pa las gzhan pa de dang lhan cig rgyu ba spyi'i yul la dran pa tha mi dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du mig dang lus dag ji ltar rang gi yul tha dad pa la dmigs pa las gzhan pa de dang lhan cig rgyu ba spyi'i yul la dran pa tha mi dad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is said that the eye and the body are not different from the memory consciousness that has a general object, even though they have different objects.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The reason is contradictory to the pervasion.

original: byis pa'i brjod pa 'ga' las gus pa ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i brjod pa 'ga' las gus pa ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What respect can be paid to the statements of children?

original: 'dir re zhig bkag pa ni gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig bkag pa ni gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Here, the refutation is set forth.

original: gzhan dag gi gzugs la sogs pas rdzas tha dad pa'i phyir dang / snang ba de sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi gzugs la sogs pas rdzas tha dad pa'i phyir dang / snang ba de sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par snang ba yin te /
translated: Others say that the object of memory is not established because it is different in substance from form, etc., and because it appears different from form, etc., like blue.

original: dbang po'i yul gcig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gcig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of a single sense faculty.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa ni brdzun te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa ni brdzun te /
translated: The assertion that it is the same here is false.

original: de bzhin du 'di sngon po dri zhib mos mngar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di sngon po dri zhib mos mngar ba'o //
translated: It is like this: this is sweet, that is bitter.

original: 'di rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rtsub pa'o //
translated: This is rough, that is smooth.

original: zhes so sor snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: zhes so sor snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Thus, different appearances is stated.

original: mngon sum la don snang ba tha dad pa med kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la don snang ba tha dad pa med kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the appearance of the object in perception, there is a difference in the appearance of the object in inference.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is form, etc.

original: 'di dag 'jig rten la grags pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag 'jig rten la grags pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are explained as being well-known in the world.

original: de dag yul tha dad pa med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag yul tha dad pa med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And those are not without a difference in object,

original: thigs pa dang bcas pa rnam pa bcur yod pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thigs pa dang bcas pa rnam pa bcur yod pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are described as having ten aspects with a drop.

original: de ltar na dbang po gcig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa nyid du zin kyang rlung dang tsha ba'i rigs bya ba la sogs pa ni ci rigs par 'di lan yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po gcig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa nyid du zin kyang rlung dang tsha ba'i rigs bya ba la sogs pa ni ci rigs par 'di lan yin no //
translated: Thus, even though they are to be apprehended by a single sense faculty, wind, heat, and water, etc. are the appropriate answers.

original: 'dis kyang gtan tshigs la nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gtan tshigs la nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses the certainty of the reason.

original: chos can dang 'brel par khas blangs su zin kyang dbang po gcig gi yul yin pa nyid du ma nges par bshad pa dang / 'di dag la yod pa ma yin pas phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can dang 'brel par khas blangs su zin kyang dbang po gcig gi yul yin pa nyid du ma nges par bshad pa dang / 'di dag la yod pa ma yin pas phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Even though the connection with the subject is accepted, it is explained that it is not ascertained as being the object of a single sense faculty, and since this does not exist for them, it is not established with respect to one part.

original: dri mngar ba la sogs pa rdzas 'dzin par byed par dbang po gang gis ji ltar gzung bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: dri mngar ba la sogs pa rdzas 'dzin par byed par dbang po gang gis ji ltar gzung bar bya ba yin /
translated: How is it that the sense faculty apprehends the substance of sweet smell, etc.?

original: rdzas dbang po thams cad kyis thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas dbang po thams cad kyis thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that substance is apprehended by all the sense faculties.

original: @81a * // snang ba dang sngon po la sogs pa tha mi dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: @81a * // snang ba dang sngon po la sogs pa tha mi dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Light and blue, etc. are not different at all,

original: gang gi phyir sgron ma dang nye ba las gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi yul can du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgron ma dang nye ba las gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi yul can du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because when close to a lamp, the aspect of the nature of the luminous entity arises as the object of the sense faculty.

original: de dag tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pas des sgrub pas stong pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pas des sgrub pas stong pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since they are not different, it is thought that the proof is empty.

original: khyed kyis 'di mngon sum nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis 'di mngon sum nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: You should accept this as direct perception.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be established as direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Because it is like this, etc. is easy to understand.

original: khyed kyis bum pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par khas blangs pas ci'i 'di rin med par 'tshong bar byed dam /
analyzed: khyed kyis bum pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par khas blangs pas ci'i 'di rin med par 'tshong bar byed dam /
translated: Why do you sell this pot for free, since you accept that it is different from form, etc.?

original: 'dis kyang de 'jig rten tha dad pa 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis kyang de 'jig rten tha dad pa 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: This also shows that the world is different from it,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du ston par so sor mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du ston par so sor mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear to be the specific nature of that.

original: rang nyid mngon sum du byed par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum du byed par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: It is the self that one wishes to perceive directly,

original: rdzas ni mthong ba dang reg pa yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni mthong ba dang reg pa yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the philosophical theory explains that substance is seen and touched.

original: de ltar bdag nyid 'di rgyun tu dga' ba'i gnyen bshes kyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes kha bskang ngo //üîΩrin med par 'tshong bar 'dod pa yod pa ni rin la 'tshong ba de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba med pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid 'di rgyun tu dga' ba'i gnyen bshes kyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes kha bskang ngo // rin med par 'tshong bar 'dod pa yod pa ni rin la 'tshong ba de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba med pa'o /
translated: Thus, the self is known by its friends and relatives, and this is supplied to the verse.üîΩThere is no one who wishes to sell for free, and one who sells for free is like that, that is, he does not exist.

original: yang na 'tshong ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa 'di ni rin med pa de ltar 'tshong ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'tshong ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa 'di ni rin med pa de ltar 'tshong ba yin no //
translated: Or, one who has the nature of selling is like that, that is, he sells for free.

original: 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: gang mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the direct perception of the object.‚Äù

original: rin med par yang rang ngo bo 'jog pa ni bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rin med par yang rang ngo bo 'jog pa ni bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
translated: To posit a nature without a price is ridiculous.

original: blo dgra dag yod pas gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa'i bum pa gcig yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo dgra dag yod pas gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa'i bum pa gcig yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Since the mind and words are different, isn‚Äôt there a single pot that is the possessor of form and so on?

original: 'di byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is the product of those?

original: de dag gis blo dang sgra tha dad pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis blo dang sgra tha dad pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: He also explains that the mind and words are different.

original: thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang rgyu dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang rgyu dag go //
translated: The words ‚Äúnot by all‚Äù and so on refer to difference, nondifference, and causes.

original: gal te blo dang sgra la sogs pa de dag gis rdzas de sgrub par 'dod pa ni grub par ro //
analyzed: gal te blo dang sgra la sogs pa de dag gis rdzas de sgrub par 'dod pa ni grub par ro //
translated: If you assert that that substance is established by those minds and words and so on, it is established.

original: rdzas 'di so sor snang bar gyur du zin kyang lan tshva'i ro rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i khanda'i ro bzhin du nye bar mi rtogs pa des na de sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod @81b par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas 'di so sor snang bar gyur du zin kyang lan tshva'i ro rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i khanda'i ro bzhin du nye bar mi rtogs pa des na de sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod @81b par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Even though these substances appear individually, they are not perceived like the taste of sugar that overwhelms the taste of salt. Therefore, you must state the reason that proves that.

original: bshad pa / mngon sum gyi ngo bo mi mthong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / mngon sum gyi ngo bo mi mthong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: It is not logical that the nature of direct perception is not seen,

original: rdzas gzhan gyis zil gyis ma mnan pas so //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan gyis zil gyis ma mnan pas so //
translated: because it is not overwhelmed by other substances.

original: zil gyis mnan pa yin na ni rigs te /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan pa yin na ni rigs te /
translated: If it were overwhelmed, it would be logical.

original: dper na khanda'i ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khanda'i ro bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the taste of sugar.

original: 'dir yang cung zad cig zil gyis non pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang cung zad cig zil gyis non pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, too, because it is not overwhelmed in the least,

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams yod do zhe na /
translated: blue and so on exist.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rdzas du ma dang ldan pa'i chen po'i ngo bo nyid nye bar dmigs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i rlung ni mi dmigs so zhes brjod pa de yang mi mthong ba'i de dag kyang mi mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas du ma dang ldan pa'i chen po'i ngo bo nyid nye bar dmigs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i rlung ni mi dmigs so zhes brjod pa de yang mi mthong ba'i de dag kyang mi mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the nature of a great many substances is observed, in the same way, the unconditioned wind of form is not observed. To say that is not seen is also not seen. It follows that those are not seen.

original: des na thams cad mi rtogs par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgongs so //
analyzed: des na thams cad mi rtogs par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that all would not be understood, and the conventions of the world would be explained.

original: gang gis yan lag can de mi rtogs na sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis yan lag can de mi rtogs na sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not understand that whole, the reason that establishes it should be stated.

original: de dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rtags khas blang bar bya zhing nye bar gzung bar bya ba yin na de go bar byed pa'i rtags ni cung zad cig kyang med do zhes de skad du sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rtags khas blang bar bya zhing nye bar gzung bar bya ba yin na de go bar byed pa'i rtags ni cung zad cig kyang med do zhes de skad du sngar bshad do //
translated: If one accepts and holds the reason that establishes that thing, there is not the slightest reason that makes it understood, as was previously explained.

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yod na de yang yod pa yin no zhes na /
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yod na de yang yod pa yin no zhes na /
translated: If there is a valid cognition that understands that, then that also exists.

original: mngon sum nyid med pa la tshad ma ma yin pas yod par khas blangs par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid med pa la tshad ma ma yin pas yod par khas blangs par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Since direct perception itself is not a valid cognition, it is not reasonable to accept that it exists.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa 'dis mngon sum las tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bshad pa gang dang gang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de dang de ni yod par khas blang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa 'dis mngon sum las tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bshad pa gang dang gang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de dang de ni yod par khas blang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever nonexistence of a valid cognition that establishes something, that is accepted as the existence of that.

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a sky-lotus.

original: yan lag can yang yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i dgag pa'i 'bras bu can gyis mi dmigs pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: yan lag can yang yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i dgag pa'i 'bras bu can gyis mi dmigs pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: Since there is no valid cognition that establishes the existence of the whole, the nonapprehension that has the effect of a negation that is used in the expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is intended.

original: de ltar rdzas gcig med pa rgya cher bstan nas rnal ma'i mjug bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar rdzas gcig med pa rgya cher bstan nas rnal ma'i mjug bsdu ba ni /
translated: Thus, having extensively explained the nonexistence of a single substance, he concludes the main point.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na de srid du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de srid du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù concludes the context of the root text.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag blo la sogs pa ldog pa ni mdo la sogs pa de dag ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag blo la sogs pa ldog pa ni mdo la sogs pa de dag ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the cessation of the mind and so on is not the cessation of those s≈´tras and so on.

original: gang dang gang yod pa de dag sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ji @82a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang yod pa de dag sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ji @82a * //
translated: How could that which is not established as existent or non-existent be refuted?

original: ltar ldog par 'gyur zhing de med par sgrub par byed par 'dod par 'gyur zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ltar ldog par 'gyur zhing de med par sgrub par byed par 'dod par 'gyur zhes dgongs so //
translated: How could it be maintained that it is established as non-existent?

original: gal te blo la sogs pa yod pa de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par mi byed kyi don byed pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te blo la sogs pa yod pa de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sgrub par mi byed kyi don byed pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If you say that the existence of cognition and so on is not established as either different or non-different, but is established as performing a function, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: don byed pa yod pas na tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don byed pa yod pas na tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that it is conventionally existent because it performs a function.

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that it exists because it is realized.

original: 'dis 'u bu cag la 'dir mtshungs par mthong bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'u bu cag la 'dir mtshungs par mthong bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: We see that this is the same for us here, but others argue otherwise.

original: bshad pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yod pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yod pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We say that the convention of existence as different or non-different is not tenable.

original: gcig gis kyang don du ma byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang don du ma byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that even one does not perform a function.

original: 'o na rkyen gcig gis skye ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar de skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na rkyen gcig gis skye ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar de skad bshad ce na /
translated: But if not even one arising exists due to a single condition, how can it be explained in this way?

original: bden te / gcig kyang tshogs pa mang po dang 'brel ba 'di las don du ma byed par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te / gcig kyang tshogs pa mang po dang 'brel ba 'di las don du ma byed par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is true that a single condition is not related to many arisings, but it is explained that a single condition produces many effects.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshogs pa las ni thams cad 'byung /
analyzed: tshogs pa las ni thams cad 'byung /
translated: Everything arises from a collection.

original: gcig las gcig ni cung zad med //
analyzed: gcig las gcig ni cung zad med //
translated: Not even a little arises from a single thing.

original: tshogs pa gcig par gyur na yang /üîΩde ni du ma byed par bshad //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig par gyur na yang / de ni du ma byed par bshad //
translated: Even when a single collection exists,

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: it is explained that it produces many.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na mar me gcig gi rnam par shes pa dang sdong bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang 'bar ba zhes dngos po gzhan du rgyu dang 'brel ba'i skad cig ma gzhan skye ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig gi rnam par shes pa dang sdong bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang 'bar ba zhes dngos po gzhan du rgyu dang 'brel ba'i skad cig ma gzhan skye ba yin te /
translated: For example, the consciousness of a single lamp, the transformation of the wick, and the flame are different things, and the arising of another moment is related to the cause.

original: de nyid yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the different things that are conventionally designated as existing.

original: ji ltar gcig las du ma'i 'bras bu skye ba'i yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig las du ma'i 'bras bu skye ba'i yin no zhe na /
translated: How is it that many effects arise from a single cause?

original: 'di 'dra ba'i gcig pa las 'bras bu du ba bskyed pa la brten pa khyad par du gyur ba'i ngo bo dang ldan par rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dngos po'i tshul de nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i gcig pa las 'bras bu du ba bskyed pa la brten pa khyad par du gyur ba'i ngo bo dang ldan par rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dngos po'i tshul de nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that the effect, smoke, arises from a cause that possesses a special nature, which is dependent on such a singularity. This is the way of things.

original: de ltar mig la sogs pa du ma las kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa du ma las kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, we see that a single consciousness can arise from many eyes and so on.

original: tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the reason why there is a convention of nondifference.

original: gzegs zan gyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i blos smras pa /üîΩmi smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzegs zan gyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i blos smras pa / mi smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The materialist, with a mind that has gone astray, says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe non-Buddhist schools say that the self is the experiencer of pleasure and pain.

original: 'on kyang ma mthong ba'i don byed pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas yod pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma mthong ba'i don byed pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas yod pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: But they are different in terms of the distinct functions that they perform, even though they are not seen.‚Äù

original: de nyid bsal bar bya ba ni gang don byed par sbrang rtsi'i bza' ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid bsal bar bya ba ni gang don byed par sbrang rtsi'i bza' ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The refutation of this is as follows: The function is the characteristic of the honey, the food, and so on.

original: de la snam @82b bu la sogs pa la mthong ba'i yod pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa gzhan du mthong ba des ni rnam pa de lta bu yod pa tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la snam @82b bu la sogs pa la mthong ba'i yod pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa gzhan du mthong ba des ni rnam pa de lta bu yod pa tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the existence of cloth, etc. is seen in the warp, etc. and the existence of pot, etc. is seen elsewhere. Thus, the proof of the existence of a different kind is established.

original: bum pa la sogs pa de dag ni khyab pa smra ba pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de dag ni khyab pa smra ba pa yin no //
translated: These pots, etc. are the subject of the pervasion.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na snam bu la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa ma mthong ba la bum pa ma mthong bar 'gyur ba ni yod pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed do zhes snal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na snam bu la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa ma mthong ba la bum pa ma mthong bar 'gyur ba ni yod pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed do zhes snal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: For example, in the case of cloth, the non-seeing of the function of holding water, etc. is the non-seeing of the pot. This is the proof of the existence of a different kind. This is applied to the warp.

original: 'di dag ni dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dper brjod pa'o //
translated: These are the examples.

original: snal ma dag la gos la sogs pa'i don byed pa ma mthong ba la gzhan mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos nye bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa tha dad pa snal ma dang snam bu ma grub bo zhes bya
analyzed: snal ma dag la gos la sogs pa'i don byed pa ma mthong ba la gzhan mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos nye bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa tha dad pa snal ma dang snam bu ma grub bo zhes bya
translated: In the case of the warp, the non-seeing of the function of cloth, etc. is the seeing of something else. This is the teaching of the property of the subject. This is the proof of the existence of a different kind. The warp and cloth are not established.

original: ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder.

original: des ni 'di bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bur bshad do //
analyzed: des ni 'di bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bur bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the result of accomplishing this.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: gang gi phyir de ma mthong ba'i don byed pa'i rgyus yod pa tha dad pa dang 'dir rjes su 'brel to zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ma mthong ba'i don byed pa'i rgyus yod pa tha dad pa dang 'dir rjes su 'brel to zhe na /
translated: Because of that, the cause of the unseen object is different from existence, and here it is connected.

original: des ni 'di'i snal ma snam bu gzhan nyid du grub mod kyi /
analyzed: des ni 'di'i snal ma snam bu gzhan nyid du grub mod kyi /
translated: By that, the thread of this is established as different from the cloth.

original: yan lag can don gzhan du grub pa ma yin no snyam du slob dpon gyis dgongs nas /
analyzed: yan lag can don gzhan du grub pa ma yin no snyam du slob dpon gyis dgongs nas /
translated: But the whole is not established as a different object. Thinking this, the master says:

original: de ltar grub pa yin mod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar grub pa yin mod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is established in this way.

original: snal ma dang snam bu yod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba snal ma'o //
analyzed: snal ma dang snam bu yod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba snal ma'o //
translated: The existence of the thread and the cloth is different.

original: khyed la 'dod pa'i don grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: khyed la 'dod pa'i don grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs nas bshad pa /
translated: Thinking that the desired object is not established, it is explained:

original: de ltar don gzhan pa'i yan lag can bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar don gzhan pa'i yan lag can bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the whole as a different object is not established.

original: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dper na rkyen gyis 'di 'dus byas pa'i rang bzhin la tha dad pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rkyen gyis 'di 'dus byas pa'i rang bzhin la tha dad pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, due to conditions, the nature of the compounded produces difference.

original: rgyus don byed par tha dad pa gos la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyus don byed par tha dad pa gos la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te //
translated: This is what is being taught:üîΩThe cloth, etc., are produced from the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.

original: snal ma bsdoms par bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa tha ga la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las khyad par can gyi dbyibs rgyun mi 'chad pa snal ma las skye'o //üîΩgos la sogs pa'i don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni snga ma las snam bu gzhan nyid du kho bo cag 'dod pa yin no //üîΩkhyad par can gyi dbyibs rgyun mi 'chad pa ni ma yin pas don gzhan la yan lag can du 'dod pa 'di spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: snal ma bsdoms par bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa tha ga la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las khyad par can gyi dbyibs rgyun mi 'chad pa snal ma las skye'o // gos la sogs pa'i don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni snga ma las snam bu gzhan nyid du kho bo cag 'dod pa yin no // khyad par can gyi dbyibs rgyun mi 'chad pa ni ma yin pas don gzhan la yan lag can du 'dod pa 'di spangs pa yin la /
translated: The cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.

original: 'dis ni rnam phug pa'i snga ma dang phyi mar @83a * //üîΩ'jug pa nyid la sogs pa bshad pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam phug pa'i snga ma dang phyi mar @83a * // 'jug pa nyid la sogs pa bshad pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: The cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa'ang spangs pa'i rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa'ang spangs pa'i rig par bya'o //
translated: The cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, because the cloth, etc., are the effects of the cause, the threads, and the cloth, etc., are the characteristics of the cause, the threads.üîΩThe cloth

original: kho bo cag ni rgya cher bkag zin pas yang brjod par mi byed do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgya cher bkag zin pas yang brjod par mi byed do //
translated: We have already refuted this extensively, so we will not elaborate further.

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis rang bzhin khyad pa can du skyed pa'i don byed pa tha dad pa yin no snyam nas bshad pa /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis rang bzhin khyad pa can du skyed pa'i don byed pa tha dad pa yin no snyam nas bshad pa /
translated: It is the meaning of generating a specific nature through the power of conditions, which is the performance of different functions.

original: gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa las zhes bya ba sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa las zhes bya ba sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The statement from the different states of rubbing the stick and so on is easy to understand.

original: dpe bstan nas don bstan pa ni //
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don bstan pa ni //
translated: Having taught the example, he teaches the meaning:

original: de bzhin de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Likewise, that and so on.

original: 'dis ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rang bzhin tha dad pa'i don gcig skyed par byed do //üîΩ'o na snal ma dang snam bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rang bzhin tha dad pa'i don gcig skyed par byed do // 'o na snal ma dang snam bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This shows that conditions generate a single meaning with a different nature according to the conditions.

original: blo dang sgra tha dad pa las ji ltar 'di gzhan pa nyid med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: blo dang sgra tha dad pa las ji ltar 'di gzhan pa nyid med pa yin zhe na /
translated: But then, if the cloth and the threads are not different, how is it that the cognition and the word are different?

original: de dgag par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bshad pa de dag gis ni blo dang sgra tha dad pa yang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dgag par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bshad pa de dag gis ni blo dang sgra tha dad pa yang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that this should be refuted, he explains that the difference in cognition and word is also explained by those.

original: de la sngar gang bshad pa de ltar gnas pa de'i phyir yod pa tha snyad grub par gyur pa ldog pa ni don byed pa ldog pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la sngar gang bshad pa de ltar gnas pa de'i phyir yod pa tha snyad grub par gyur pa ldog pa ni don byed pa ldog pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: As previously explained, because of that, the reversal of existence that is established conventionally is the object of the convention of the reversal of the performance of function.

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: de tsam zhig sma'i /
analyzed: de tsam zhig sma'i /
translated: We say just that much.

original: de nyid don byed pa log pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid don byed pa log pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the reversal of the performance of function.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa dag gis ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa dag gis ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that are not objects of observation do not establish it.

original: 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa mi 'dod pa de ni don nus pa'i yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa mi 'dod pa de ni don nus pa'i yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: That which is an object of observation and is not observed is not accepted as existent, and that which is not existent is not able to perform a function.

original: khyed kyis ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyed kyis ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: How could you understand it?

original: mi dmigs pa tsam ni brjod par mi rigs te de 'khrul ba'i phyir de ni mi 'dod pa yang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam ni brjod par mi rigs te de 'khrul ba'i phyir de ni mi 'dod pa yang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that mere non-observation is that, because it is mistaken. It is also not accepted.

original: khyed kyis don byed pa 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dang yod pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis don byed pa 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dang yod pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: You say that the object of the convention of non-existence is that which is an object of observation and the performance of function, and is not observed.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: yod pa zhes bya ba nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúexistence‚Äù because it has the characteristic of potentiality.

original: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the fault?

original: bshad pa de lta na yang kho bos brjod pa snga ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: bshad pa de lta na yang kho bos brjod pa snga ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
translated: We reply: Even so, what is the difference between this and what we have said previously?

original: de dmigs par bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir nus pa 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba khyed kyis btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dmigs par bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir nus pa 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba khyed kyis btags pa yin no //
translated: You have merely imputed this non-observation of potentiality because you do not observe the object of observation.

original: de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dod par gyur kyang gang @83b gi nus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dod par gyur kyang gang @83b gi nus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even if you accept that the non-observation of its nature is the non-observation of potentiality, what is its potentiality?

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúits potentiality, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar de'i nus pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de'i nus pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-observation of its potentiality is just its nature.

original: de'i phyir snga ma'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di nus pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di nus pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of its nature is the non-observation of potentiality.

original: de bas na snang du rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na snang du rung ba mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of what is suitable to appear is the proof of the term non-existence. This is the correct position.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir 'dis dgos pa 'ga' zhig gis ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad du bya bar khas len pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir 'dis dgos pa 'ga' zhig gis ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad du bya bar khas len pa ni /
translated: Since this is so, therefore, one should accept that the convention of non-existence of rabbit horns, etc. is due to some purpose.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should accept it through the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: gzhan du na blta bar bya ba'i thabs med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na blta bar bya ba'i thabs med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no means of seeing it. This is the idea.

original: des na mi dmigs pa de ni spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa gzhan yang rnam pa de lta bus dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa de ni spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa gzhan yang rnam pa de lta bus dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, that non-apprehension is not different from the apprehension of other things, such as universals, particulars, possessing wholes, and so on, which are of that kind.

original: spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa de bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa de bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that universals, particulars, etc. would become the objects of the convention of non-existence in that way.

original: spyi dang bye brag la sogs pa 'di lta bu'i mi dmigs pa yin yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag la sogs pa 'di lta bu'i mi dmigs pa yin yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even though there is non-apprehension of universals, particulars, etc. in this way, they do not become the objects of the convention of non-existence.

original: bshad pa 'ga' zhig tu ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'ga' zhig tu ma yin te /
translated: Some explanations are not correct.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad bya bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad bya bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should accept that the expression ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used when there is no difference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: 'dir mi dmigs pa gnyi ga'i don la yang mi dmigs pa de'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsal te spyi la sogs pa la khas blangs pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi dmigs pa gnyi ga'i don la yang mi dmigs pa de'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsal te spyi la sogs pa la khas blangs pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: Here, both non-apprehensions are refuted by the reason of the same meaning, and the expression ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used for universals, etc.

original: 'on te gzhan du yang khas len na med pa'i gtan tshigs su khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du yang khas len na med pa'i gtan tshigs su khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if one accepts otherwise, then there is no difference in the reason of nonexistence, as explained above.

original: 'ga' zhig med par khas len pa de'i mtshan nyid la khyad par med par dran par byed do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med par khas len pa de'i mtshan nyid la khyad par med par dran par byed do //
translated: One should remember that the definition of the acceptance of the nonexistence of something is the same.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul no zhes bya bas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul no zhes bya bas khyab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all such types of non-apprehension are pervaded by being the object of the expression ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i yul du grub pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i yul du grub pa'o //
translated: This establishes the object of non-apprehension.

original: ser skyas sgra thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: ser skyas sgra thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Kapila says that sound is the nature of all things.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'o ma dang sa las bum pa dang zho dang myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa'i @84a * //üîΩbdag nyid med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'o ma dang sa las bum pa dang zho dang myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa'i @84a * // bdag nyid med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that were not so, then if the nature of a pot, curd, a sprout, etc. were not present in a lump of clay, milk, and a seed, etc.,

original: de ji ltar de las de dag skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de las de dag skye bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could they arise from them?

original: ri bong gi rva dang rta'i rva med pa ni de la skye ba med do //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang rta'i rva med pa ni de la skye ba med do //
translated: The nonexistence of a rabbit‚Äôs horns and a horse‚Äôs horns does not arise from them.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gi bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gi bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Thus, in some cases, a pot, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni yul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni yul la sogs pa'o //
translated: In some cases, a country, etc.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ni dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa snang du rung ba'i yod pa'i mi dmigs su zin kyang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no zhes de dag gi dogs pas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ni dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa snang du rung ba'i yod pa'i mi dmigs su zin kyang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no zhes de dag gi dogs pas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In some cases, a particular shape, etc. are suitable to appear. Even though they are not observed, they are not objects of the convention of nonexistence. Thus, because of their doubt, he says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚ÄùüîΩA hundred elephants

original: rtsva mchog rtse la glang chen brgya //
analyzed: rtsva mchog rtse la glang chen brgya //
translated: at the tip of a blade of grass

original: sngon chad ma mthong yod do zhes //
analyzed: sngon chad ma mthong yod do zhes //
translated: have never been seen before, but it is said that they exist.

original: de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
analyzed: de skad grangs can phyugs las gzhan //
translated: The CƒÅrvƒÅkas, however, are not like this.

original: ngo mtshar bcas pas su brjod rtsol //
analyzed: ngo mtshar bcas pas su brjod rtsol //
translated: They are full of wonder and try to express themselves.

original: zhes dgongs nas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes dgongs nas thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With this in mind, he says, ‚ÄúEverything . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba de la yod pa yin pa de'i tshe thams cad ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma mthong ba de la yod pa yin pa de'i tshe thams cad ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: When something is not seen, it exists. Everything, such as milk,

original: thams cad ni bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad ni bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the cause of everything, such as yogurt, because it is the basis of the effect. Everything is the effect of everything, such as milk, because it is the result of the cause. Therefore, everything is the cause and effect of everything.

original: gzhan yang 'di gzhan las ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di gzhan las ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is not from another.

original: zho la sogs pa 'bras bur 'dod pa ni 'o ma la sogs pa las 'byung gi chu la sogs pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa 'bras bur 'dod pa ni 'o ma la sogs pa las 'byung gi chu la sogs pa las ma yin no //
translated: What is asserted as the effect, such as yogurt, arises from milk and so on, not from water and so on.

original: yang na 'di ni chos la sogs pa ste sbrang rtsi la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni chos la sogs pa ste sbrang rtsi la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Or this is a property of the milk and so on, not of the honey and so on.

original: de bzhin du gur gum la sogs pa 'di ni kha che ba'i yul 'di ni yin gyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du gur gum la sogs pa 'di ni kha che ba'i yul 'di ni yin gyi //
translated: Similarly, this saffron and so on is from Kashmir, not from Malaya and so on.

original: 'di ma la ya la sogs pa'i yul 'di ma lags te /
analyzed: 'di ma la ya la sogs pa'i yul 'di ma lags te /
translated: This is not from that place, Malaya and so on.

original: yang na tsan dan la sogs pa'i 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na tsan dan la sogs pa'i 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, this is sandalwood, etc., but not that.

original: kun da la sogs pa dgun smad kyi dus 'di'i tshe yin gyi sos ka'i dus 'di'i tshe na ma yin no //
analyzed: kun da la sogs pa dgun smad kyi dus 'di'i tshe yin gyi sos ka'i dus 'di'i tshe na ma yin no //
translated: This is kunda, etc., at the time of late winter, but not at the time of spring.

original: yang na padma la sogs pa 'di'i tshe ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na padma la sogs pa 'di'i tshe ma yin no //
translated: Or, this is lotus, etc., at this time, but not at that time.

original: de bzhin du khanda la sogs pa mngar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can 'di lta bu yin gyi 'di rtsa ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'di lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khanda la sogs pa mngar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can 'di lta bu yin gyi 'di rtsa ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'di lta bu ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, this is the special quality of sweetness, etc., of sugar, etc., but not this kind of nature of root, etc.

original: yang na 'di ni ma la ya la sogs pa 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni ma la ya la sogs pa 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Or, this is Malaya, etc., but not that.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag de lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag de lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they like that?

original: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of a cause of that kind,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu mngar ba'i ngo bo 'di med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu mngar ba'i ngo bo 'di med pa yin no //

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no cause for that kind of thing.

original: thams cad du thams cad @84b ngo bo rnams kyi thams cad kyi tshe 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad @84b ngo bo rnams kyi thams cad kyi tshe 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is the intention that in all cases, all entities are engaged in this.

original: 'o na de ma thag tu bshad pa'i dngos po nyid 'di ni thams cad kyi tshe don byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang de ma thag tu bshad pa'i dngos po nyid 'di 'dir ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na de ma thag tu bshad pa'i dngos po nyid 'di ni thams cad kyi tshe don byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang de ma thag tu bshad pa'i dngos po nyid 'di 'dir ci zhig bya /

original: 'di dag btags pa la 'thag pas chog go zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag btags pa la 'thag pas chog go zhe na /
