original: bden te / rgyur gyur pa'i byed pa sngar bshad nas /
analyzed: bden te / rgyur gyur pa'i byed pa sngar bshad nas /
translated: It is true that the cause was explained earlier,

original: da ni 'bras bur gyur pa khyad par yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: da ni 'bras bur gyur pa khyad par yin pas skyon med do //
translated: but now the effect is distinguished, so there is no fault.

original: 'di yang skyon gzhan gyi sgo nas tshig lhag ma bstan pa yin no //üîΩdes na dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag med par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di yang skyon gzhan gyi sgo nas tshig lhag ma bstan pa yin no // des na dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag med par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This also teaches the remainder of the sentence from another perspective.üîΩTherefore, because there is no difference in entity, it is applied that where there is no coming and going.

original: 'di 'dir yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dir yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is applied that where there is no coming and going, there is no this exists and so on.

original: med do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the negation.

original: gzhan gyi smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe state‚Äù and so on. This is the point:

original: gang dang gang la 'jug pa de dang de ni de la yod pa yin no zhes bya bas kha bskang ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang la 'jug pa de dang de ni de la yod pa yin no zhes bya bas kha bskang ste /

original: gang dang gang 'jug pa de ni de la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang 'jug pa de ni de la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di skyon ma yin no //

original: slob dpon gyis de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The master says ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid kyi gnas skabs ldog par tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khyed cag gi lta ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gnas skabs ldog par tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khyed cag gi lta ltar ma yin te /
translated: That state does not become different in terms of negation, as you assert.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul thams cad la yod pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thams cad la yod pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de lta na yang yul 'ga' zhig la med pa'i tha snyad du 'dod de de'i tshe de'i rgyu rnams khyed kyis brjod dgos so snyam nas /

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Thinking that, he says ‚Äúsome.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig la gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i ldog pa 'dis yan lag can la sogs pa la med pa'i tha snyad du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i ldog pa 'dis yan lag can la sogs pa la med pa'i tha snyad du khas blang bar bya'o //

original: yul 'ga' zhig la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúin some cases,‚Äù etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa las gzhan med par rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: When there is no exclusion apart from the object, there is no reason for exclusion.

original: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is for the purpose of establishing.

original: de yang khyod 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de yang khyod 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sgrub pa'i dngos po ni 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: dgag pa ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //

original: rnam par gcod pa ni @85a * //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ni @85a * //

analyzed: bshad pa ma dmigs pa de gang la yod de thams cad med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu mi dmigs pa 'dir yang mi dmigs par 'gyur na /

analyzed: de lta ma yin na yan lag can 'di la med pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin du chug kyang 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin du chug kyang 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa mngon sum gyis mi dmigs so //
translated: Even if it is the case that it is an object of apprehension, curd, etc. are not directly perceived in milk, etc.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag la @86a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag la @86a * //
translated: However, they are inferred.

original: la nus pa med pa las mi skye ba yin pa des na de ldog kyang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du de mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: la nus pa med pa las mi skye ba yin pa des na de ldog kyang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du de mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since they are not produced from a non-potent cause, even when that is absent, they do not become the object of the convention of non-existence.

original: ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù etc.

original: gang gis gzhan dmigs pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas 'di mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dmigs pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas 'di mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By what inference is this non-apprehension of the other established?

original: gzhan mi dmigs pa las kyang ci ste sbyor bar mi byed ce na de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan mi dmigs pa las kyang ci ste sbyor bar mi byed ce na de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the nature of that,‚Äù etc.

original: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gzhan du gyur pa ni 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gzhan du gyur pa ni 'phos pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the nature of that which is the objective support of the apprehension is the transference.

original: de'i de ma thag tu mngon sum du de ma gyur ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu mngon sum du de ma gyur ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it not be present immediately after that.

original: zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum de nyid de mi dmigs pa la ltos nas gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis med pa la sogs ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum de nyid de mi dmigs pa la ltos nas gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gis med pa la sogs ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: By this, he shows that that very perception, in dependence on that non-apprehension, proves something non-existent, etc., by some reason.

original: sbyor ba yang gang gi tshe ma lus pa nye ba'i nus pa dang 'brel ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid dang ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang gi tshe ma lus pa nye ba'i nus pa dang 'brel ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid dang ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the application is this: when the cause is related to the capacity of the whole, then at that time, the arising is not dependent.

original: dper na nus pa thogs pa med pa'i tshogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nus pa thogs pa med pa'i tshogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a sprout arising from a cause that is a collection of capacities that are unobstructed.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la yang ji skad bshad pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pas zho la sogs pa'i yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la yang ji skad bshad pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pas zho la sogs pa'i yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Likewise, in the case of milk and so on, the consciousness arises in regard to the object, curd and so on, because it possesses the property of the subject as explained. This is a natural inference.

original: gnyis pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: The second is the observation of the contradictory of the pervasion in regard to the probandum.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid du de 'gyur bas 'di'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid du de 'gyur bas 'di'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: It is the reason for this because it is otherwise.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gzhan du yod par 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nyid dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gzhan du yod par 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nyid dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is asserted to exist in another mode, and so on, it would not be observed as the observed object,

original: snga ma'i ngo bo nyid 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i ngo bo nyid 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previous entity would have been transferred.

original: de lta na yang de'i ngo bo rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i ngo bo rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, it would follow that its entity would be destroyed without interruption.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bsags par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bsags par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, and so on, the fault is to be accumulated.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di ma skyes shing 'jigs pa med pa'i ngo bo khyad par 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di ma skyes shing 'jigs pa med pa'i ngo bo khyad par 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because this entity is not arisen and does not have the nature of ceasing, this is the distinction.

original: btags pa'i ngo bo gcig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pa'i ngo bo gcig pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the imputed is the nature of the one.

original: rdzas gzhan gyis bar du chod pa dang ring po na gnas pa dag kyang /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan gyis bar du chod pa dang ring po na gnas pa dag kyang /
translated: Even those that are obstructed by substantial others and those that are distant

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid la sogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid la sogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: would be direct perception and not direct perception, etc.

original: bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po @86b ma yin pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po @86b ma yin pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Without obstruction and not distant, and abiding, etc.

original: bar du chod pa dang ring po na gnas pa 'di yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar du chod pa dang ring po na gnas pa 'di yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Those that are obstructed and distant do not exist.

original: dpe la las bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po ma yin pa ni gnas pa zhes 'don to //
analyzed: dpe la las bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po ma yin pa ni gnas pa zhes 'don to //
translated: In some texts, without obstruction and not distant is ‚Äúabiding.‚Äù

original: de la bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa zhes dgag pa'i tshig re re zhing bsdu ba bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la bar du chod pa med pa dang ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa zhes dgag pa'i tshig re re zhing bsdu ba bya ba nas /
translated: In that, without obstruction and not distant is the negation of each term.

original: phyis ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
translated: Later, a special collection will be made.

original: gcig kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la ltos nas mngon sum ma yin pa la 'gal ba med pa nyid do zhes na /
analyzed: gcig kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la ltos nas mngon sum ma yin pa la 'gal ba med pa nyid do zhes na /
translated: Even one thing is not a direct perception in relation to some person, there is no contradiction in saying that.

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthat very thing,‚Äù

original: de yang dmigs phye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'i mngon sum du gyur pa /
analyzed: de yang dmigs phye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'i mngon sum du gyur pa /
translated: and that is a direct perception in the state of being perceived, etc.,

original: gzhan la mngon sum ma yin pas ci zhig nyams na /
analyzed: gzhan la mngon sum ma yin pas ci zhig nyams na /
translated: but is not a direct perception in relation to others. What is the loss?

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i gnas de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i gnas de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthat very thing, the state of the sense faculty, etc.,‚Äù

original: 'di dbang po ma nyams pa de'i gnas skabs yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dbang po ma nyams pa de'i gnas skabs yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and this is connected with the phrase, ‚Äúin the state of unimpaired sense faculty.‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos pa ni yid mkhyen pa la spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni yid mkhyen pa la spangs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the mental faculty.

original: res 'ga' zhig mngon sum par gsal ba'i dus su mngon sum yin pa dang / res 'ga' mngon par mi gsal ba'i tshe mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig mngon sum par gsal ba'i dus su mngon sum yin pa dang / res 'ga' mngon par mi gsal ba'i tshe mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Sometimes, in the state of being clearly perceived, it is a direct perception, and sometimes, in the state of not being clearly perceived, it is not a direct perception.

original: gang gis mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni res 'ga' nus pa med pas mi skye ba rjes su dpag pa yin pa dang / res 'ga' gsal ba'i gnas skabs mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni res 'ga' nus pa med pas mi skye ba rjes su dpag pa yin pa dang / res 'ga' gsal ba'i gnas skabs mngon sum yin no //
translated: Sometimes, when the capacity is absent, the non-production is inferred; sometimes, the manifest state is direct perception.

original: gang gis de skad du brjod pa la 'dir yang mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gang gis de skad du brjod pa la 'dir yang mi rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is unreasonable about this statement?

original: bshad pa / 'ga' zhig la khyad par med na zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'ga' zhig la khyad par med na zho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: If there is no difference between them, then these states of curd, etc. are contradicted by direct perception, etc.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba gang yin pa de dag khyad par med pa'i phyir gcig pa mi srid de /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba gang yin pa de dag khyad par med pa'i phyir gcig pa mi srid de /
translated: Since they are mutually contradictory, they cannot possibly be identical.

original: dper na grang ba dro ba'i reg bya la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grang ba dro ba'i reg bya la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like cold and hot tactile objects, etc.

original: mngon sum pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'ga' bas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal bar dmigs pa yin no ;
analyzed: mngon sum pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'ga' bas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal bar dmigs pa yin no ;
translated: Since direct perception, etc. are mutually contradictory, the pervasion is contradicted.

original: / gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: / gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: khyad par med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no difference.

original: gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid khyad par gcig ldog pa na gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan skye ba yod pa ma yin pas 'o ma dang zho'i tha snyad khas len pa'o //üîΩ'di ni skye ba dang 'jig @87a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid khyad par gcig ldog pa na gsal ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan skye ba yod pa ma yin pas 'o ma dang zho'i tha snyad khas len pa'o // 'di ni skye ba dang 'jig @87a * //
translated: When the characteristics of the state of milk are reversed, the characteristics of the state of clarity do not arise as another, and therefore the conventions of milk and yogurt are accepted.

original: pa'i ngo bo khyad par la sogs pa ma grub par smra ste /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo khyad par la sogs pa ma grub par smra ste /
translated: This is the assertion that the nature of arising and disintegration is not established.

original: re zhig khyad par 'di dang khyad par ldan pa tha dad par khas mi len te /
analyzed: re zhig khyad par 'di dang khyad par ldan pa tha dad par khas mi len te /
translated: First, this difference and the possessor of the difference are not accepted as distinct.

original: khas len pa nyid la de'i gnas skabs gzhan du byas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khas len pa nyid la de'i gnas skabs gzhan du byas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were accepted, the error of its being another state of that would occur.üîΩTherefore, this is the error in the non-difference of that.

original: de'i phyir 'di tha dad pa med pa nyid de la skyon 'di yin no snyam du dogs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di tha dad pa med pa nyid de la skyon 'di yin no snyam du dogs nas bshad pa /
translated: Fearing that this might be thought, it is explained:

original: khyad par de'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa gcig nyid la ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: khyad par de'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa gcig nyid la ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: If the characteristics of the state of that difference, the characteristics of the state of that difference, were to cease in just one thing without being followed by the state of possessing that difference,

original: ji ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag 'dren par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag 'dren par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not bring about the various kinds of pleasure and pain.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang bdag nyid du gyur pa de dang de ni gcig ldog na ldog pa yin pa 'am 'jug na 'jug nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang bdag nyid du gyur pa de dang de ni gcig ldog na ldog pa yin pa 'am 'jug na 'jug nges par 'gyur te /
translated: And the application is that whatever is of the nature of something, when that one ceases, it ceases, or when it occurs, it occurs.

original: dper na de'i bdag nyid khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de'i bdag nyid khyad par bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the particular of its nature.

original: khyad par dang khyad par ldan pa yang bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pas zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par ldan pa yang bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pas zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the particular and the possessor of the particular are of the nature of something.

original: des na gnas skabs gnas skabs can de dag sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gnas skabs gnas skabs can de dag sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the various states are various.üîΩBecause mutually contradictory properties are present, like pleasure and pain.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos nye bar gnas pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //üîΩkhyad par 'di rjes 'gro med pa 'am /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos nye bar gnas pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no // khyad par 'di rjes 'gro med pa 'am /
translated: This is a reason of nature.üîΩThis particular does not follow,

original: ldog pa dang 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa dang 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: or it does not cease or occur.

original: des na snga ma'i sbyor ba ni dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin la /
analyzed: des na snga ma'i sbyor ba ni dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the former syllogism is an example of a thesis that is empty of the probandum.

original: phyi ma ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The latter is an example of an unestablished reason.

original: bshad pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pas khyad par 'jug pa dang ldog pa yan lag tu byed pa gcig pa la 'jug pa dang ldog pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pas khyad par 'jug pa dang ldog pa yan lag tu byed pa gcig pa la 'jug pa dang ldog pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: What is the difference between the inclusion and exclusion that are associated with the application of a qualifier and the inclusion and exclusion that are associated with the application of a single term?

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni ci yang med de /
translated: There is no difference between inclusion and exclusion.

original: thams cad thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that everything is included in everything else.

original: skyon gsal bar bshad pa /
analyzed: skyon gsal bar bshad pa /
translated: The faults of the opponent‚Äôs position are stated

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du bshad pa dang rang nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa shes pa yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du bshad pa dang rang nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa shes pa yin na //
translated: Moreover, if you explain that a certain nature is a qualifier and you know that it is included in some things and excluded from other things,

original: khyed ni khyad par gcig ldog pa khyad par gzhan skye bar tha snyad tha dad pa las len to zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: khyed ni khyad par gcig ldog pa khyad par gzhan skye bar tha snyad tha dad pa las len to zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: then you accept that the exclusion of one qualifier is the arising of another qualifier, and you do this on the basis of a difference in terms.

original: de'i tshe de dag nyid gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la goms par byas pa'i dri ma med @87b pa'i blos smra ba na bzhin 'dzum pa'i rjes su khas mi len tam /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag nyid gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la goms par byas pa'i dri ma med @87b pa'i blos smra ba na bzhin 'dzum pa'i rjes su khas mi len tam /
translated: At that time, when they themselves speak with a stainless intellect that is familiar with the speech of the Transcendent Lord, do they not accept the smiling face?

original: gal te 'di skad du 'gyur yang ji ltar bdag ni 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du 'gyur yang ji ltar bdag ni 'jug pa na /
translated: If they say, ‚ÄúEven though it is so, when we engage in analysis,

original: ldog pa lhag par rjes su shes pa de bzhin du des kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skye ba 'jig par khas blang bar byed pa yin na kho bo mngon par gsal ba dang mi mngon pa tsam la ji lta bu ci ste khas mi len par
analyzed: ldog pa lhag par rjes su shes pa de bzhin du des kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skye ba 'jig par khas blang bar byed pa yin na kho bo mngon par gsal ba dang mi mngon pa tsam la ji lta bu ci ste khas mi len par
translated: we understand that the opposite is the case. In the same way, we should accept that arising is destroyed without persistence,‚Äù then why do they not accept that it is merely manifest or not manifest?

original: byed ces gzhan dag brgya la smra ba la dogs nas 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: byed ces gzhan dag brgya la smra ba la dogs nas 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If others suspect that we say this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this in the following:üîΩYou who are confused about existence,üîΩyou who speak of persistence here,

original: khyed cag yod pa la rmongs pa bdag 'dir rjes su 'gro bar smra ba de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyed cag yod pa la rmongs pa bdag 'dir rjes su 'gro bar smra ba de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: you should say what persistence is.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba gang yin /
translated: What is persistence?

original: dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la zhes bya ba 'di 'dun pa yin no /
analyzed: dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la zhes bya ba 'di 'dun pa yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúThings‚Äù refers to arising and cessation.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: 'dir khyed kyis brjod pa'i nus pa'i rjes 'gro'i dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyed kyis brjod pa'i nus pa'i rjes 'gro'i dngos po skye ba dang 'jig pa dag la yod pa'o //
translated: Here, the existence of the power that you assert is in things that arise and cease.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it related to them?

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i sngar dang 'jig pa'i phyis kyang yod pa'i nus pa ni gnas skabs can gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i sngar dang 'jig pa'i phyis kyang yod pa'i nus pa ni gnas skabs can gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because the power exists prior to arising and after cessation, it has the characteristic of being a state.

original: gang gis 'di dag 'di ltar yin pa des na dngos po 'di phyis yod pa thams cad du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di dag 'di ltar yin pa des na dngos po 'di phyis yod pa thams cad du skye ba yin no //
translated: Since it is like this, this thing is later produced from all that exists.

original: 'on kyang nus pa'i ngo bo las phyis rnam par gnas pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa'i ngo bo las phyis rnam par gnas pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, because it becomes manifest from the nature of the power later, it endures.

original: thams cad yin no zhes thams cad du 'dzin pas shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad yin no zhes thams cad du 'dzin pas shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is all, it is apprehended as all and is known.

original: de bzhin du gcig pa yin pas phyis kyang 'jig pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig pa yin pas phyis kyang 'jig pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, since it is one, it does not later cease, but it is not manifest.

original: med pa skye ba yang ma yin la yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa skye ba yang ma yin la yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that what is nonexistent arises, nor that what is existent arises.

original: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The Master says:

original: gal te nus pa dang bcas pa thams cad du gsal bar mi mngon pa'i dus dang gsal ba las khyad par med pas gcig gi ngo bo khyad par spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang bcas pa thams cad du gsal bar mi mngon pa'i dus dang gsal ba las khyad par med pas gcig gi ngo bo khyad par spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If all that is endowed with the capacity is not clearly manifest at all times, then there is no difference between it and what is clearly manifest. Thus, the meaning is that the nature of one is abandoned.

original: da ni 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa ci zhig yin /
analyzed: da ni 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa ci zhig yin /
translated: Now, what is it that is endowed with a difference here?

original: 'o ma dang zho dang dar ba la sogs pa'i rim pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di gang gis byas /
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang dar ba la sogs pa'i rim pa'i tha snyad kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di gang gis byas /
translated: By what is this distinction in the conventional expressions of milk, curd, cream, and so on made?

original: grangs can gyis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can gyis smras pa /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya says:

original: gal te gnas skabs ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is due to the possession of a state,

original: slob dpon gyis gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Master says, ‚ÄúA state‚Äù and so on.üîΩSince another state is not possible, the product is devoid of conceptual distinctions.

original: gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pas byas pa rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis @88a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pas byas pa rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis @88a * //
translated: The two are

original: yin te / ngo tsha med pa'i rtsod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: yin te / ngo tsha med pa'i rtsod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right to argue without shame.

original: de nyid dam gzhan nyid las phan tshun spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan nyid las phan tshun spangs pa yin te /
translated: It is mutually exclusive with identity and difference,

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gsum pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gsum pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a third alternative, namely, that it has the characteristic of abiding, is not evident.

original: gcig pa yin pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gcig pa yin pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with saying that it is identical?

original: gcig pa gcig pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gcig pa gcig pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is identical,

original: ji ltar 'di gcig la rnam par dbye ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gcig la rnam par dbye ba yin /
translated: how can it be a division of that?

original: yod pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rang gi ngo bo rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rang gi ngo bo rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for an existent to be divided into itself.

original: ltos nas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ltos nas yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a division in terms of dependence,

original: rnam grangs med pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam grangs med pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúWithout a distinction in terms of the object.‚Äù

original: de phan tshun 'gal ba dag ji ltar rigs par 'gyur bshad pa /
analyzed: de phan tshun 'gal ba dag ji ltar rigs par 'gyur bshad pa /
translated: How can it be reasonable for mutually exclusive things to be identical?

original: skye ba'i gnas skabs dang / gang mi skye ba'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas skabs dang / gang mi skye ba'i nus pa'o //
translated: The state of being produced and the state of having the potential not to be produced are mutually exclusive.

original: de lta bu ni don byed pa'i nye bar mkho ba yin gyi nus pa'i gnas skabs ni mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni don byed pa'i nye bar mkho ba yin gyi nus pa'i gnas skabs ni mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: The state of having the potential to perform a function is necessary, but the state of having the potential to be produced is not necessary.

original: sbyor ba ni nus pa las kyang skye ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni nus pa las kyang skye ba yod pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Even though something has the potential to be produced,

original: gnas skabs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not produced because it does not differ from the state of having the potential to be produced.

original: gnas skabs kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: like the own nature of the state.

original: yang na gnas skabs kyi skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs kyi skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, it is not the arising of the state,

original: nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: like the own nature of the potentiality.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is observed by the contradiction of the reason of essence.

original: gnas skabs kyi 'di nyid kyis don byed pa dang 'brel ba dang / don byed pa ma 'brel ba dang / ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa dag sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi 'di nyid kyis don byed pa dang 'brel ba dang / don byed pa ma 'brel ba dang / ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa dag sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By this very state, the pervasion is observed by the contradiction of the reason of essence in the cases of connection with the performance of function, disconnection from the performance of function, reversal, non-reversal, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni ltung ba dang zhes bya ba mi ltung ba la sogs pa sbyar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni ltung ba dang zhes bya ba mi ltung ba la sogs pa sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes ‚Äúfalling‚Äù and ‚Äúnot falling,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang grangs can gyi 'dod pa'i dgos pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs can gyi 'dod pa'i dgos pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the purpose asserted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is

original: gal te gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThe state and so on,‚Äù

original: rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis gnas skabs la nus pa gzhan ma yin pas gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis gnas skabs la nus pa gzhan ma yin pas gzhan nyid do //
translated: the state is not another potentiality by some enumeration, so it is different.

original: des na skye ba la sogs pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na skye ba la sogs pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, arising and so on are not contradictory.

original: khyed rang gi phyogs srung bas g-yengs ba'i blo bdag nyid kyang brjod ngas pa bskyungs pas yin no zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: khyed rang gi phyogs srung bas g-yengs ba'i blo bdag nyid kyang brjod ngas pa bskyungs pas yin no zhes dgongs nas /
translated: You have been distracted by your own defense, and have forgotten your own position.

original: brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúYou are forgetful, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gzhan yin pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan yin pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di med de /
translated: Because this fault does not occur in the position of the other,

original: kho bo cag gis bshad pa gzhan nyid kyi phyogs yin pas gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis bshad pa gzhan nyid kyi phyogs yin pas gzhan nyid do //
translated: it is the position of the other that we explain, and so it is the other.

original: 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de nyid rim gyis bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rim gyis bshad par bya ste /
translated: That will be explained in due course.

original: 'on te nus pa dang gnas skabs 'di'i rnam par dbye ba gzhan @88b nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'gal yang med do //
analyzed: 'on te nus pa dang gnas skabs 'di'i rnam par dbye ba gzhan @88b nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'gal yang med do //
translated: But if the difference of the potency and the state is the difference of the other, then there is no contradiction in the contradiction.

original: dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not just that things that arise and are destroyed are associated with something else.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gang gi rjes su 'gro ba'i nus pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi rjes su 'gro ba'i nus pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: Because that which is asserted to be the potency of what follows is not the arising and destruction of that.

original: rtag pa gcig pu nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa gcig pu nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists as the nature of permanent singularity.

original: yang na gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba dang gnas pa'i 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid du mngon par 'dod pas de'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba dang gnas pa'i 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid du mngon par 'dod pas de'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Or, because those that are asserted to be the states of arising, enduring, and disintegrating do not follow that.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising and destruction as different and not different do not have the nature of states.

original: nus pa dang gsal ba de dag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba'i ser skya'o //
analyzed: nus pa dang gsal ba de dag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba'i ser skya'o //
translated: The assertion of the followers of Kapila is that there is no error because there is no difference between potency and manifestation.

original: lan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis so //
analyzed: lan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis so //
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúThere is no response,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir rigs pa med pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa med pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the lack of reasoning here?

original: gang gis na de ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang gis na de ltar brjod ce na /
translated: By what is it said in that way?

original: bshad pa / tha dad pa med ces bya ba ni gcig par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / tha dad pa med ces bya ba ni gcig par brjod pa'o //
translated: The response: ‚ÄúNondifference‚Äù is expressed as ‚Äúsingularity.‚Äù

original: nus pa dang gsal ba tha dad pa de dag ces pa 'di yang tha dad pa brten pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang gsal ba tha dad pa de dag ces pa 'di yang tha dad pa brten pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tha snyad yin no //
translated: And the difference between the potency and the manifestation is also a difference based on a different cause.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas bkod pa ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas bkod pa ma spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot existent‚Äù means that the superimposition by conceptualization has not been eliminated.

original: gzhan yang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag dang ldog pa med pa dang rab tu skye ba med par yod pa dang / de bzhin du gnas pa dang mi gnas par gyur pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag dang ldog pa med pa dang rab tu skye ba med par yod pa dang / de bzhin du gnas pa dang mi gnas par gyur pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, there is cessation and arising, noncessation and nonarising, and likewise, there is abiding and nonabiding, and so on. The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is to be applied to going and not going, and so on.

original: khyed kyi tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid 'di dag ji ltar rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid 'di dag ji ltar rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are these characteristics of difference tenable for you?

original: 'di ltar gnas skabs kyi ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba bdag dang ldog pa med pa dang / rab tu skye ba med pa dang ldan pa'i nus pa tha dad pa ni khyed mi 'dod pa de bzhin du nus pa dang gnas skabs kyang yin la gnas skabs can ma yin pa dang nus pa ni de dag las gzhan pa nyid mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas skabs kyi ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba bdag dang ldog pa med pa dang / rab tu skye ba med pa dang ldan pa'i nus pa tha dad pa ni khyed mi 'dod pa de bzhin du nus pa dang gnas skabs kyang yin la gnas skabs can ma yin pa dang nus pa ni de dag las gzhan pa nyid mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, just as you do not accept that the power is different from the state that is distinguished and that is generated, and from that which is distinguished and not generated, and from that which is generated and not generated, in the same way, we do not accept that the power is different from the state and that which is not the state, and that the power is different from those.

original: ci'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it of various natures?

original: bshad pa 'di dag ni ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dang ldog pa med pa dang rab tu skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dag ni ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dang ldog pa med pa dang rab tu skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: These explanations are different, such as distinguished and generated, and not distinguished and not generated.

original: 'di ltar gang dag ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa de ni de las tha dad par 'gyur te /üîΩdper na shing @89a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa de ni de las tha dad par 'gyur te / dper na shing @89a * //
translated: Thus, that which is distinguished and not distinguished, and so on, would be different from that.

original: ta la dang tam la sogs par grags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ta la dang tam la sogs par grags pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the well-known tƒÅla and tamƒÅla trees.

original: de dag dang bral ba ni tha dad pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ni tha dad pa med pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The absence of that is non-differentiation.

original: 'o na byung ba dang ma byung ba las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa 'di dag lhan cig skye ba dang / 'jig par rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na byung ba dang ma byung ba las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa 'di dag lhan cig skye ba dang / 'jig par rig par bya ba ste /
translated: Now, these cognitions and mental activities, etc., which are definitely separate as to their occurrence and non-occurrence, should be known as co-originated and co-destructed.

original: de dag tha mi dad pa ni ma yin na de dag dang mi 'bral ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar bshad ce na //
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad pa ni ma yin na de dag dang mi 'bral ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar bshad ce na //
translated: If they are not non-differentiated, how can it be explained that they are non-differentiated as to their non-separation?

original: de dag skye ba la sogs pa tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyor //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la sogs pa tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyor //
translated: They are asserted to be differentiated as to their origination, etc.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dpe gnyis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dpe gnyis bshad pa ni /
translated: Two examples are given in order,

original: dpe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as in the case of the lamp and its light, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la brten pa sngar ji skad du bshad pa de'i tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnam par gzhag paüîΩma yin no /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la brten pa sngar ji skad du bshad pa de'i tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúIn another way‚Äù means that when it is based on the characteristics of difference and non-difference, as previously explained, there is no difference and non-difference in the arrangement of difference and non-difference because of the cause of non-difference.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can gzhan phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can gzhan phan tshun du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every case‚Äù means that pleasure, etc. and the sentient being are mutually different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can tha dad pa 'gyur ba la bde ba la sogs pa so sor tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can tha dad pa 'gyur ba la bde ba la sogs pa so sor tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if pleasure, etc. and the sentient being are different, then pleasure, etc. would be individually different.

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúin the nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: gzhung lugs las grags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhung lugs las grags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa /
translated: The characteristics of difference and non-difference, which are well known in the philosophical systems, have been explained.

original: de bas na 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, there is a contradiction‚Äù refers to arising and non-arising, etc. that were just explained.

original: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jim pa'i nur bu dang bum pa dag ni rten dang brten pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jim pa'i nur bu dang bum pa dag ni rten dang brten pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of clay‚Äù and so on means that the clay and the pot are not the support and the supported.

original: 'on te de ltar na 'jim pa'i bdag nyid mgrin pa la sogs par dbyibs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig rgyun mi 'chad pa ni bum pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na 'jim pa'i bdag nyid mgrin pa la sogs par dbyibs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig rgyun mi 'chad pa ni bum pa zhes brjod do //
translated: If that is so, then the nature of clay, such as the neck and so on, is a particular shape that is uninterrupted, and that is called a pot.

original: 'o na 'jim pa'i rdzas gcig pa thams cad la 'dis byas pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jim pa'i rdzas gcig pa thams cad la 'dis byas pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that all of the clay is made by this?

original: khams gsum pa'i 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gcig ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i 'jim pa'i bdag nyid gcig ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of clay in the three realms is not the same.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause the individual appearances of consciousness are different‚Äù should be supplied.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa rnam pa nyid kyi rdzas rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa rnam pa nyid kyi rdzas rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the individual consciousnesses that appear as different substances are different.

original: de bzhin du gnas skabs tha dad pa ni tha dad par @89b gnas pa'i phyir dang so so'i don gyi bya ba bshad pa ni tha dad pa'i sgo nas rdzas kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas skabs tha dad pa ni tha dad par @89b gnas pa'i phyir dang so so'i don gyi bya ba bshad pa ni tha dad pa'i sgo nas rdzas kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the different states are different because they exist separately, and the explanation of the function of each object is because of the difference in the nature of the substance through the difference.

original: phan tshun mi srid pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun mi srid pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are cause and effect because they are mutually impossible. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyis kyang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs dang sems can tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs dang sems can tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, others accept the atoms, darkness, and sattva as different from sentient beings.

original: 'di dag nyid rgyur rig pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rgyur rig pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: These are known as the causes.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, he says.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa'i so sor snang ba tha dad pa la tha dad pa 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa'i so sor snang ba tha dad pa la tha dad pa 'dod do //
translated: If the different appearances of consciousness are accepted as different,

original: sems rnams zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig ste skye bu yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sems rnams zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig ste skye bu yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: the minds, which is a plural word, are the person, this is the conclusion.

original: ji lta ba de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as, he says, the different appearances of consciousness, etc.

original: slar yang bshad pa /
analyzed: slar yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is explained:

original: yod kyang 'di rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod kyang 'di rnam par rig pa so sor snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though they exist, they are called ‚Äòthe different appearances of individual awareness.‚Äô

original: bdag nyid 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni nus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni nus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAny identity‚Äù means that they are the same in terms of the conformity of their capacities.

original: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The master responds:

original: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa dang / sems pa can 'di dag kyang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa dang / sems pa can 'di dag kyang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then it follows that these sentient beings, such as the one who is happy, are not different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yon tan nyid dang za ba po dang byed pa po gnyis la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yon tan nyid dang za ba po dang byed pa po gnyis la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro /
translated: This is because they conform to the qualities of happiness and so on, as well as to the two, the experiencer and the agent.

original: sems pa can za ba po dang byed pa po dang yon tan la sogs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: sems pa can za ba po dang byed pa po dang yon tan la sogs pa dang ngo //
translated: The sentient being is the experiencer, the agent, and the qualities and so on.

original: de bzhin bde ba la sogs pa dang sems can yang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin bde ba la sogs pa dang sems can yang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Likewise, happiness and so on conform to the existence of sentient beings and so on.‚Äù This is the idea.

original: sbyor ba dag kyang skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag kyang skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: The application is also not different from the person, pleasure, etc.

original: phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i phyir nus la dang gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i phyir nus la dang gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: Because of the mutual conformity and non-conformity, like the potential and the manifest.

original: nus pa dang gsal ba yang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang gsal ba yang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: The potential and the manifest are also not different.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba brjod pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba brjod pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can bzhin no //
translated: Because of the expression of conformity and non-conformity, like pleasure, etc. and the conscious being.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: These are natural syllogisms.

original: 'o na gang la thams cad bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba de la tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gang la thams cad bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba de la tha mi dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Now, if everything conforms to the self, then it is not different.

original: gang la bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis ma yin gyi thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rjes su 'gro ba des na 'di la skyon med ce na /
analyzed: gang la bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis ma yin gyi thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rjes su 'gro ba des na 'di la skyon med ce na /
translated: If it is not so that some entity such as a pot is not so, but everything conforms to the self, then there is no fault.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang ngo bo @90a * //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no // 'on kyang ngo bo @90a * //
translated: But pots, etc. do not conform to the self in every way.

original: 'ga' zhig gis te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis te /
translated: However, it is by some entity.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin zhes bya bar smra'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin zhes bya bar smra'o //
translated: We reply: No, it is not only pleasure, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs la yang lhan cig skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs la yang lhan cig skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the various natures would be co-arisen, etc.

original: 'di ltar gnas skabs thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba gcig pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas skabs thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba gcig pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it would be the case that there would be a single entity that pervades all aspects and all times.

original: des na sna tshogs pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dag gi khyad par mi nus pa dang shugs dang smin pa med pas sna tshogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sna tshogs pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dag gi khyad par mi nus pa dang shugs dang smin pa med pas sna tshogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the various natures are not able to produce differences in form, smell, and taste, and since they are not powerful and are not ripening agents, they are not various.

original: de ltar na shing la sogs pa lnga pa dang ldan pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am shing la snod du thal bar 'gyur ba dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na shing la sogs pa lnga pa dang ldan pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am shing la snod du thal bar 'gyur ba dgongs so //
translated: Thus, it would follow, absurdly, that the five, such as the tree, would not possess the sixth, or that the tree would be a pot.

original: lhan cig skye ba ni gnas skabs thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba ni gnas skabs thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Co-arisen should be applied to all times.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni lhan cig 'gag pa dang don byed pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni lhan cig 'gag pa dang don byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to co-ceasing and the performance of functions.

original: byed pa dang 'gyur ba bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang 'gyur ba bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: And the activity and the transformation must be accepted as being the same.

original: sbyor ba yang gang khyad par can gzugs dang dri dang ro dang nus pa rnams kyi du ma'i rnam par mi 'gyur ba de ni sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang khyad par can gzugs dang dri dang ro dang nus pa rnams kyi du ma'i rnam par mi 'gyur ba de ni sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: And the application is this: Whatever is not a variety of forms, smells, tastes, and potentials, is not a nature that is a variety.

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig tu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig tu bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of a single thing, such as pleasure.

original: de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang bshad ma thag pa'i chos dag med pas zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang bshad ma thag pa'i chos dag med pas zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no ;
translated: In the same way, the context of the desired object is not a reason that is not established, since the properties that were just explained do not exist.

original: / gang dang gang tha dad pa med ba de dag dang de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa du mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gang dang gang tha dad pa med ba de dag dang de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa du mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And whatever is not different from those things is not a variety of forms and so on.

original: dper na de'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like its own nature.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang tha dad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang tha dad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The context of the desired object is not different is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de bzhin du gang dang gang las tha dad par ma gyur ba de dang de ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang gang las tha dad par ma gyur ba de dang de ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, whatever is not different from something else is endowed with the arising, etc. of the arising, etc. of that other thing.

original: dpe na de nyid rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe na de nyid rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like that very thing itself being endowed with its own nature.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa yang tha mi dad par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa yang tha mi dad par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the assertion of a different state would not be different, this is a natural inference.

original: de lta ma yin na bum pa 'di zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bum pa 'di zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mi rigs pa'am /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be reasonable for this pot to be not different,

original: ming gi rnam grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gi rnam grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would be a synonym.

original: don tha dad pa khas len pa la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tha dad pa khas len pa la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in the assertion of a different meaning.

original: skyon bsags pa ni bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag @90b nyid kyi don tha dad pa 'ga' zhig mig phye yang 'di bum pa 'jim pa'i bdag tu tha dad pa'i nye bar mtshon pa'i med do //
analyzed: skyon bsags pa ni bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag @90b nyid kyi don tha dad pa 'ga' zhig mig phye yang 'di bum pa 'jim pa'i bdag tu tha dad pa'i nye bar mtshon pa'i med do //
translated: The accumulation of faults is that even with open eyes, one does not see any different object of the nature of pot and clay, or any indication of a different pot from the nature of clay.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'di rab tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'di rab tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'gyur //
translated: Why is it that it arises in this way?

original: 'di ni de tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni de tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the characteristic of non-difference, which is completely incoherent.

original: 'o na bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid kyi gong bu ngo bo tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na bum pa dang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid kyi gong bu ngo bo tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: But the lump of clay and the pot are different in nature, and this is clearly the case.

original: de skad du bshad pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is this explained?

original: yod pa ni bden pa te /
analyzed: yod pa ni bden pa te /
translated: Existence is truth.

original: gzhan bum pa las tha dad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan bum pa las tha dad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes dgongs so //
translated: Since it is not accepted that it is different from the other, the pot, there is no fault. This is the intended meaning.

original: gal te de dag tha dad par nye bar mi mtshon pa de lta bu yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag tha dad par nye bar mi mtshon pa de lta bu yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, why is it not the case that it is like this?

original: gnas dang gnas pa rten dang brten pa 'di 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug dag bzhin du tha dad par mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ni 'dir rab tu skye ba 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa rten dang brten pa 'di 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug dag bzhin du tha dad par mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ni 'dir rab tu skye ba 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The place and the thing placed, the support and the supported, would not be perceived as different, as in the case of the dish and the cakes.

original: 'dis ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang bum pa de rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid dang bum pa de rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: This is not so, because the clay and the pot are not the support and the supported,

original: tha dad pa nye bar mi mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa nye bar mi mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their difference is not perceived.üîΩThe existence, etc., of that is like its own nature.

original: yod pa la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i zhes dgongs so //
translated: The non-apprehension of the pervader is intended.üîΩThus, whatever arises from whatever, that is not different from that.

original: de ltar na gang dang gang las rab tu skye ba de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma brjod pa ni bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar na gang dang gang las rab tu skye ba de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tha med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma brjod pa ni bshad pa /
translated: The characteristic of non-difference is not stated.

original: nus pa'i bdag nyid rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa'i bdag nyid rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The effect does not arise from a cause that is capable by nature,

original: de ni rtag pa'i gnas skabs kyi gnas skabs su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa'i gnas skabs kyi gnas skabs su khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it exists in a permanent state.

original: de lta ma yin na gnas skabs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnas skabs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be a state.

original: de ltar de'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pas tha mi dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar de'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pas tha mi dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by accepting that it is of that nature, it is not nondifferent,

original: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the characteristic of nondifference.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: de'i gsal ba bde ba dang skye bu la sogs pa rnams la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gsal ba bde ba dang skye bu la sogs pa rnams la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifestation of that is the same in pleasure, the person, etc.

original: gzhan yang rang gi lta ba'i skyon gyis gos pa'i blo can gyis grangs can 'ga' zhig 'di skad du gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las tha dad pa yin pa te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi lta ba'i skyon gyis gos pa'i blo can gyis grangs can 'ga' zhig 'di skad du gang dang gang yongs su gyur pa de dang de las tha dad pa yin pa te /
translated: Moreover, some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, whose minds are covered by the faults of their own views, say this: Whatever undergoes transformation is different from that.üîΩFor example, like the differences in the states of a golden earring, etc.

original: dper na gser gyi rna cha la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang snga ma'i tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa @91a * //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi rna cha la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang snga ma'i tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa @91a * //
translated: That is also refuted by the teaching of the pervasion by the characteristic of difference of the prior.

original: bstan pa 'dis bsal ba bzhin yin no zhes bya ba de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bstan pa 'dis bsal ba bzhin yin no zhes bya ba de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: By this teaching of the refutation, he says, ‚ÄúThose who say that, etc.‚Äù

original: khyed kyis bstan pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang mi rigs so zhes dgongs pa dang ldan pas spang bar mdzad pa ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis bstan pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang mi rigs so zhes dgongs pa dang ldan pas spang bar mdzad pa ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is it that you reject?

original: pha rol po ni 'dir brjod par bya ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: pha rol po ni 'dir brjod par bya ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What is there to be said here by the opponent?

original: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das ser skyas bshad pa 'di bzang po yin no snyam du bsams nas smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das ser skyas bshad pa 'di bzang po yin no snyam du bsams nas smras pa /
translated: As long as the Blessed One thinks that this statement by Kapila is good, he says:

original: gnas skabs can gyi rdzas la yongs su ma gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs can gyi rdzas la yongs su ma gyur pa ni /
translated: A substance that has a state does not transform.

original: dper na gser gyi chos gzhan dpung rgyan log nas chos gzhan rna rgyan la sogs pa rab tu skye ba yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi chos gzhan dpung rgyan log nas chos gzhan rna rgyan la sogs pa rab tu skye ba yin no zhes smras so //
translated: For example, when a golden ornament is destroyed, another ornament such as earrings is produced.

original: slob dpon gyis de nyid la re zhig 'di 'dra ba'i shes rab 'khrul ba ji ltar rung ba yin snyam nas ngo bo ni ngo mtshar ba dang snying brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de nyid la re zhig 'di 'dra ba'i shes rab 'khrul ba ji ltar rung ba yin snyam nas ngo bo ni ngo mtshar ba dang snying brtse ba yin te /
translated: The Master thinks, ‚ÄúHow can such confused wisdom be correct?‚Äù He is amazed and has compassion.

original: de gzhan gyi rjes su zlog pa skyabs med pa'i 'jig rten mun pas khyab pa srog chags la phan par 'dod pa las zlog pa su'i nyes pa yin /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi rjes su zlog pa skyabs med pa'i 'jig rten mun pas khyab pa srog chags la phan par 'dod pa las zlog pa su'i nyes pa yin /
translated: Whose fault is it that the world, which is without refuge and covered by darkness, is turned away from that which is beneficial for living beings?

original: gal te de nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te de nyid bshad pa /
translated: If you say that it is explained in this way,

original: khyod mi dpyod par 'jug gam zhe na /
analyzed: khyod mi dpyod par 'jug gam zhe na /
translated: then is it that you do not analyze when you engage in it?

original: bshad pa / chos gzhan rna cha la sogs pas gang yin pa de zlog pa dang rab tu skye bar gyur pa de ci rdzas de nyid kyi gnas skabs yin nam /
analyzed: bshad pa / chos gzhan rna cha la sogs pas gang yin pa de zlog pa dang rab tu skye bar gyur pa de ci rdzas de nyid kyi gnas skabs yin nam /
translated: If the other phenomenon, such as an earring, is turned away from or arises, is it the state of that very substance?

original: de las don gzhan yin //
analyzed: de las don gzhan yin //
translated: Or is it something different from it?

original: ci'i phyir rnam par brtags pa gnyis kho nar byed pa yin zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / rnam par brtags pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par brtags pa gnyis kho nar byed pa yin zhe na / bshad pa / rnam par brtags pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it that only two alternatives are considered?üîΩBecause there is no other alternative.

original: gzung ba med pa de bzhin du 'di mi rigs so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa de bzhin du 'di mi rigs so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is not tenable that there is no object of apprehension.

original: gal te brtag pa dang po ltar yin pa de'i tshe skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te brtag pa dang po ltar yin pa de'i tshe skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is as in the first alternative, what is the error?

original: gang gi tshe chos gzhan de nyid dang de nyid ma yin pa'i rdzas la gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe de'i gnas skabs ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba mngon par gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos gzhan de nyid dang de nyid ma yin pa'i rdzas la gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe de'i gnas skabs ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba mngon par gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When that other phenomenon is located in a substance that is and is not real, then at that time its condition would not be characterized by cessation and arising, and by manifestation and non-manifestation.

original: de'i phyir de dag gang yin pa khyed kyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gang yin pa khyed kyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must explain what they are.

original: gang gi gnas skabs yin pa de ni ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi gnas skabs yin pa de ni ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is a condition is not cessation and arising,

original: dper na gnas skabs can gyi rdzas bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnas skabs can gyi rdzas bzhin no //
translated: like a substance that has a condition.

original: de bzhin du de gnas skabs gzhan dang chos gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnas skabs gzhan dang chos gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is the observation of an inconsistency with a pervader when you say, ‚ÄúIt is another condition because it is another phenomenon.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te gang gi @91b gnas skabs can gzhan ma yin pa de ni de'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te gang gi @91b gnas skabs can gzhan ma yin pa de ni de'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished, because that which is not another substance that has a condition is its condition,

original: dper na de'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de'i ngo bo nyid bzhin no //
translated: like its own nature.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i chos gzhan yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩgzhan yang gang gi gnas skabs can nyid kyi de'i rdzas de'i chos gzhan nam /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i chos gzhan yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // gzhan yang gang gi gnas skabs can nyid kyi de'i rdzas de'i chos gzhan nam /
translated: This is a reason of nature.üîΩMoreover, it would not be established that the state of something is a property of that substance,

original: de'i gnas skabs dang rdzas chos gzhan yin no zhes bya ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs dang rdzas chos gzhan yin no zhes bya ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that the state and substance of something are different properties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de nyid de'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that itself would not be a property of that.

original: de nyid de'i chos gzhan du gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de'i chos gzhan du gyur ba yin te /
translated: That itself would be a different property of that.

original: dper na byas pa nyid sgra las tha mi dad pa kyang de las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid sgra las tha mi dad pa kyang de las yin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that being produced is not different from sound, but it is of that.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de nyid ltos pa med pa de ni de ltos pa tha dad pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de nyid ltos pa med pa de ni de ltos pa tha dad pas zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself, without relying on that, is said to be different from that.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the point he is teaching.

original: 'dir sgra de nyid byas pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sgra de nyid byas pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i ldog pa yin no //
translated: Here sound itself is a different isolate from being produced and so on.

original: de tsam shes par 'dod pas tha dad pa gzhan spangs pa'i sgras chos nyid ston pa yin gyi 'di la ni ltos pa'i tha dad pa yang med do //
analyzed: de tsam shes par 'dod pas tha dad pa gzhan spangs pa'i sgras chos nyid ston pa yin gyi 'di la ni ltos pa'i tha dad pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúother‚Äù in ‚Äúotherness of the existent and the non-existent‚Äù is used to indicate the nature of things, but it does not indicate a different thing that is separate from the existent and the non-existent.

original: des na ji ltar de nyid chos gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar de nyid chos gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How can that which is not different from the existent and the non-existent be a different thing?

original: rdzas las chos don gzhan pa'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: rdzas las chos don gzhan pa'i phyogs yin na /
translated: If the property is different from the substance,

original: de ltar skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: what is the error in that?

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúOr, if the property is different from the substance, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag rdzas kyis yongs su gyur pa ma yin //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag rdzas kyis yongs su gyur pa ma yin //
