translated: Why is the reversal and the arising not a transformation of the substance?

original: gang gi phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag ni don gzhan gyis yongs su gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag ni don gzhan gyis yongs su gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the reversal and the arising, which are different from the substance, are not a transformation of a different thing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems dang ldan pa yang yongs su 'gyur ba ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa yang yongs su 'gyur ba ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Because the transformation of a conscious being is not accepted.

original: gtso bo skyes bu dag gcig tu gyur nas byed pa por mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo skyes bu dag gcig tu gyur nas byed pa por mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the primary being, the person, is not described as the agent after becoming one thing.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gang la don gzhan du gyur pa ldog pa rab tu skye ba der rtogs pa dag ni de'i yongs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gang la don gzhan du gyur pa ldog pa rab tu skye ba der rtogs pa dag ni de'i yongs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: The application is this: wherever the occurrence of the cessation of something else is produced, there is the transformation of that.

original: dper na sems dang ldan pa las thab dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi myu gu'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dang sems pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems dang ldan pa las thab dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi myu gu'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dang sems pa can bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cessation and production of the sprout, which has the nature of heat, is due to the mind.

original: rdzas las chos gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba'i khyab pa byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas las chos gzhan yin pas zhes bya ba'i khyab pa byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of the contradiction with the pervasion, ‚Äúbecause it is a property of a substance,‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' 'brel pa med pas kyang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag gzhan gyis yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa las yin no //
analyzed: gang don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' 'brel pa med pas kyang ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba dag gzhan gyis yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa las yin no //
translated: Whatever is something else is not the transformation of another, because it is unrelated, and its cessation and production are unrelated.

original: dper na de'i myu gu dang 'brel pa'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba'i sa bon bzhin no //üîΩdes spyi sgrub na grub @92a * //
analyzed: dper na de'i myu gu dang 'brel pa'i ldog pa dang rab tu skye ba'i sa bon bzhin no // des spyi sgrub na grub @92a * //
translated: For example, the seed, which is related to the sprout, is the cause of the cessation and production of the sprout.

original: pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If that proves the general case, it is proving what is already established.

original: chos dang rdzas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang rdzas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property and the substance are related.

original: bye brag yin na dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag yin na dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
translated: If it is a particular, the example is empty of the probandum.

original: myu gu dang sems dang ldan pa la lhan cig tu 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: myu gu dang sems dang ldan pa la lhan cig tu 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because there is no simultaneous connection between a sprout and a mind, you say.

original: rdzas kyi chos zhes bya ba yang sgra'i tha snyad mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos zhes bya ba yang sgra'i tha snyad mi 'grub po //
translated: The so-called substantial phenomenon is not established as a verbal convention.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection.

original: de ltar rdzas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i chos 'di yin no zhes bya ba de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdzas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i chos 'di yin no zhes bya ba de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, this phenomenon that is connected to another substance does not exist.

original: de gang las thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin zhes bya /
analyzed: de gang las thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin zhes bya /
translated: From what does that consequence follow? It follows from the negation.

original: de ltar na rdzas chos 'di nyid rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir yang bye brag gi gtan tshigs grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas chos 'di nyid rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir yang bye brag gi gtan tshigs grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, this very substantial phenomenon is connected by the characteristic of the supported and the supporter. Therefore, the reason of the particular is established.

original: rgyu dang 'brel ba las dngos po'i 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel ba las dngos po'i 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The connection of an entity is not another connection from the connection with a cause.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bye brag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bye brag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The relation of support and supported is also established as a specific relation of cause and effect.

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
translated: In the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrttika it says:

original: gzhi de ldog par gyur pa na //
analyzed: gzhi de ldog par gyur pa na //
translated: When the basis is reversed,

original: bdag nyid de 'dra'i rgyu 'bras yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid de 'dra'i rgyu 'bras yin //
translated: The cause and effect are of that kind.

original: zhes bya ba rdzas kyi skabs su gtan la phab zin par dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rdzas kyi skabs su gtan la phab zin par dgongs so //
translated: This is established in the section on substance.

original: 'od de de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin la rag go zhe na /
analyzed: 'od de de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin la rag go zhe na /
translated: But they are the cause and effect of light.

original: rdzas dang chos 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dang chos 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med pa yin no //
translated: But substance and attribute do not exist as cause and effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not of the nature of that is not its cause.

original: gang gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag khyed nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag khyed nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: You yourself accept that whatever is the nature of something is not its cause.

original: dper na rdul dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rdul dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of the atom and darkness.

original: de ltar yang rdzas 'di chos kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang rdzas 'di chos kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that substance would not be the intrinsic nature of that quality.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúHow can it be accepted that it is the cause of that quality?‚Äù

original: de ji ltar de'i rgyu nyid yin pas khas blang bar bya'o zhe na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i rgyu nyid yin pas khas blang bar bya'o zhe na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin par dgongs so //
translated: we think that it is not the case that the consequence of the non-observation of a pervader is not established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: You should think that the reason is not established.

original: don gzhan la brten pa'i phyir la skyon brjod pa nas rnal ma'i don bshad pa'i rdzas las chos kyang don gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan la brten pa'i phyir la skyon brjod pa nas rnal ma'i don bshad pa'i rdzas las chos kyang don gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on a different object, and because the object of the statement of the fault is explained to be the object of the statement of the natural meaning, substance and quality are different objects.

original: 'on te snga ma las bzlog nas ser skya'i dgongs pa grangs can gyi 'dod pas bcos nas byas pa ni rdzas don gzhan min du zin kyang chos kyi rgyu yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma las bzlog nas ser skya'i dgongs pa grangs can gyi 'dod pas bcos nas byas pa ni rdzas don gzhan min du zin kyang chos kyi rgyu yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you reverse the former and, having corrected the assertion of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, which is the intention of Kapila, you assert that even though substance is not a different object, it is the cause of quality,

original: chos gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúAnother quality.‚Äù

original: rdzas don gzhan min du zin kyang chos @92b kyi rgyu yin par khas len pa ni yin /
analyzed: rdzas don gzhan min du zin kyang chos @92b kyi rgyu yin par khas len pa ni yin /
translated: Even though substance is not a different object, it is asserted to be the cause of quality.

original: de bzhin du gzhan pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, an effect arises from another cause.

original: khyed kyang rdzas nyid yongs su gyur pa zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: khyed kyang rdzas nyid yongs su gyur pa zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin na /
translated: You also assert that a substance itself transforms.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: bshad pa / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs na de 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs na de 'gal ba med do //
translated: We reply: Moreover, if you follow the intention of the TathƒÅgata, there is no contradiction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des kyang rdzas bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun ni 'jim pa'i gong bu'i rdzas snga ma'i rgyur gyur pa las don gzhan pa'i 'bras bu bum pa'i rdzas phyi ma skye ba na /
analyzed: des kyang rdzas bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun ni 'jim pa'i gong bu'i rdzas snga ma'i rgyur gyur pa las don gzhan pa'i 'bras bu bum pa'i rdzas phyi ma skye ba na /
translated: Because you also accept the reason that the continuum of cause and effect of a substance is a transformation of the substance of clay, since the later substance of the effect, the pot, arises from the earlier substance of the lump of clay, which is the cause.

original: 'jim pa'i rdzas yongs su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rdzas yongs su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad khas blangs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: You accept the reason that the conventional expression ‚Äútransformation‚Äù is used.

original: gal te bdag nyid du gyur pa gnas skabs gnyis po dag kyang yongs su gyur pa'i yin par mi rigs kyi gnas skabs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid du gyur pa gnas skabs gnyis po dag kyang yongs su gyur pa'i yin par mi rigs kyi gnas skabs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that a substance that exists in two states is a transformation, but a state arises,üîΩwe reply: What is the difference between a state and a substance?

original: bshad pa / chos dang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bshad pa / chos dang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: A phenomenon and a substance, etc.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i ltar yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i ltar yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is concluded that it is not a transformation of both.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i rdzas kyi chos ma yin zhing rdzas las don gzhan pa gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i rdzas kyi chos ma yin zhing rdzas las don gzhan pa gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a phenomenon that is not a different substance, nor is it a different object from a substance.

original: 'on kyang rdzas kyi bkod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdzas kyi bkod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan yin te /
translated: However, it is a different state of the arrangement of a substance.

original: dper na sor mo dag gi dbyibs kyi bkod pa las khu tshur ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sor mo dag gi dbyibs kyi bkod pa las khu tshur ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: For example, a fist is inexpressible as being the same as or different from the arrangement of the fingers.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las sor mo nyid dbyer mi byed pa'i khu tshur ma yin te /
analyzed: de las sor mo nyid dbyer mi byed pa'i khu tshur ma yin te /
translated: Because a fist is not the fingers that cannot be separated from it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brkyang ba dag la khu tshur med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brkyang ba dag la khu tshur med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a fist does not exist in outstretched fingers.

original: de ltar ma yin na brkyang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir khu tshur gyi gnas skabs bzhin du khu tshur nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ltar bcos pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na brkyang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir khu tshur gyi gnas skabs bzhin du khu tshur nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ltar bcos pa'o //
translated: If it were not so, then because it would be no different from the extended, it would follow that the fist itself would be like the state of the extended.

original: khu tshur don gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khu tshur don gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The fist is not a different object,üîΩbecause a cause that is different from the fingers, a cause that is an obstruction to the power, a cause that arises from effort, is not observed.

original: sor mo las tha dad pa'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa rtsol ba las byung ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ser skyas res 'ga' de skad smra'o zhes 'dod pa'i dgos pa bsdu ba ni tha dad med pa zhes bya ba 'di dag bstan zin pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo las tha dad pa'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa rtsol ba las byung ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ser skyas res 'ga' de skad smra'o zhes 'dod pa'i dgos pa bsdu ba ni tha dad med pa zhes bya ba 'di dag bstan zin pa'o //
translated: The summary of the purpose of the thesis is stated in the words ‚Äúnot different.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.üîΩThe fist is the particularity of the fingers.

original: khu tshur ni sor mo dag gi khyad par gyi khu tshur yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: khu tshur ni sor mo dag gi khyad par gyi khu tshur yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: This is the reply.

original: 'dis ni sor mo nyid khyad par med pa khu tshur yin no zhes pa ji ltar dper rig pa yin /
analyzed: 'dis ni sor mo nyid khyad par med pa khu tshur yin no zhes pa ji ltar dper rig pa yin /
translated: How is this an example of the thesis that the fist is the particularity of the fingers?

original: 'dir yang brkyang pa dag la khu tshur med pa'i phyir @93a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang brkyang pa dag la khu tshur med pa'i phyir @93a * //
translated: Here also, because the fist does not exist in the extended,

original: zhes gang bshad pa de dag rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de dag rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not a correct explanation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a correct explanation?

original: sor mo nyid khyad par can gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis de bzhin skye ba 'ga' zhig khu tshur yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sor mo nyid khyad par can gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis de bzhin skye ba 'ga' zhig khu tshur yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: The fingers themselves, by the power of special causes and conditions, are sometimes a fist, but not always.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / sor mo brkyang ba las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / sor mo brkyang ba las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The fingers do not have an essential nature that is not different from an extended state.

original: khu tshur dang sor mo dag ces bya ba la dang gi sgra ni dbye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khu tshur dang sor mo dag ces bya ba la dang gi sgra ni dbye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe fingers and the fist‚Äù should be understood to indicate a distinction.

original: yang na khu tshur gyi bdag nyid kyi sor mo brkyang ba yin /
analyzed: yang na khu tshur gyi bdag nyid kyi sor mo brkyang ba yin /
translated: Or else, the fingers are a fist in the form of an extended state.

original: khyad par med pa can gyi so so ni ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa can gyi so so ni ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: They do not have an essential nature that is not different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgnas skabs gnyi ga la yang yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang yin te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause they are both states.

original: brkyang ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: brkyang ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The extended state is the state of the fingers.

original: brkyang ba dang ma brkyang ba gnyi ga'i gnas skabs kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brkyang ba dang ma brkyang ba gnyi ga'i gnas skabs kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that it would be understood in accordance with the states of both the extended and the non-extended.

original: sbyor ba yang brkyang ba'i gnas skabs ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sor mo rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang brkyang ba'i gnas skabs ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sor mo rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The syllogism is: because the state of extension is understood in the state of non-extension, and because the fingers are not different,

original: ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: it is just like the state of non-extension. This is a natural inference.

original: 'di ltar ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma brkyang ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par 'gyur ba bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the state of non-extension is understood, so it is to be applied to the other.
